description:
Private bedroom is available in a clean, spacious three bedroom single family home.

The bedroom is furnished with a twin bed, night stand, three-way lamp, chest of drawers, chair, ceiling fan/light, full length mirror, large closet and window treatment (room darkening thermal curtains over blinds). The bedroom is located on the second floor and is large enough for additional furnishing the tenant is welcome to bring. The common (shared) areas of the house include the kitchen (appliances include stove/oven, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, blender/juicer and toaster)  cabinet space, cookware and disposable dishes and utensils. The full bathroom is on the second floor adjacent to the full bathroom. The half bath, study, living room, dining room and sun porch are the common areas located on the first floor. The washer and dryer are  in the basement . Utilities - heat (gas), electric, water and WIFI are provided, the house has a monitored security system and required smoke/carbon monoxide detectors/fire extinguisher are in place.

The hosts bedroom and office are in the basement of the house,  we're available if needed. We also act as concierges since we know the Chicago area well.

The house is in the Grand Crossing community on the South Side of the city. It's a working class residential neighborhood with the amenities needed for travelers seeking to explore all Chicago has to offer.

The house is centrally located  5 minutes by car/Uber from UChicago campus/hospital in Hyde Park and 20 minutes from Downtown Chicago. There is street parking in front and quick access to I-94 Dan Ryan Expressway. The CTA 69th Red Line and King Dr Green Line stations are close by and the house is steps away from the No. 67(east/west), 3(north/south), 30(southeast) and N5(late night) CTA bus routes.

Laundry is on the ground floor of the building, and parking is available with an add-on fee.

I will be available via phone and email during your stay.

Each guest will get personal Wishbox portal on their phone, where you will be able to see all the information you need for your trip, book early check-in or late check-out, reserve fun tours and activities or buy souvenirs  


You will have the entire apartment all to yourself  -  6 bedrooms, 6 bathrooms with Jacuzzi, living room with TV ( Netflix, Amazon Prime and more ) 3 kitchens and working spaces + FREE private parking in the back of the building.  We also offer 50% discounted tickets to nearby [MUST SEE] Science and Industry Museum, and 3D movies.
description:
If you like a unique vibe, good energy, cool experience, eat or learn how to make Sushi or European food, wine, smoothies, fun activities, and tours or just relax in the front of the tv our home is for you! 

If you like someone to cook for you during your stay breakfast, lunch or dinner or take cooking/language classes also available. Â For families with kids, we offer babysitter options inside of your apartment you will stay.Â  All our locks to apartments and rooms are digital so you would not need to worry about security & keys.

Property professionally managed by Ran Fridman - Airbnb Superhost with more than 15 years of experience in the Hospitality Industry worldwide. Â We take care of each guest like Family, come and experience our hospitality. 

Thank You and we're looking forward to hosting you, my friend,Â 

Fridman Properties Family

This listing for 3 apartments in same building total of 6 bedrooms, 6 bathrooms, 3 living rooms, 3 kitchens and can accommodate up to 20 guests.  Sleeping arrangements are 6 bunk beds, 4 queen size beds, 2 twin size beds, 3 sofa bed, couch and air mattresses 	 Please note smoking allowed on the porch or outside NOT inside of the apartment. 

We offer everything, from cellphone chargers, washer and dryer, printers, hairdryers, umbrellas, irons, and all the necessary toiletries, including even makeup removal. Indoor pool and gym available two blocks away from the local YMCA community center. 

Come and enjoy our hospitality & see why our guests keep coming back. 

Fridman Properties Family

We also offer 50% discounted tickets to nearby [MUST SEE] Science and Industry Museum, and 3D movies.

We love to help visitors!  We take care of each guest like family.  We want your experience in Chicago to be AWESOME.  Please see our guestâ€™s feedback & testimonies; actual clients who stayed with us.  We assist students, faculty and visitors with many other services as well ... like helping  you to find long term rentals if you are relocating, room rentals for functions, meetings and study rooms, airport pick up & drop off services, storage space, moving, renting or buying furniture,  shopping, driving lessons, opening bank accounts and much more!  Please contact us for complete details.  We are here to help you to focus on studying, working or to simply have a great time doing what you love to do best!  We also offer 50% off on special tickets to the Science and Industry Museum + FREE parking and even 3D movies for your entertainment.  We sincerely hope you will have a truly pleasant stay with us.

Thank You,
Ran & Family

additional_house_rules:
1) The entire property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySensÂ® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $500 and asked to leave.

2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first.

3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one way or another, the apartment must be quiet.

4) Parties, events, and commercial activity are not allowed.

5) We reserve the right to ask you to leave without a refund if any of the above rules are broken.

6) Lost keys will incur a $100 charge. We have to change the locks. Please use the app to send a picture of all the keys at check-in AND check-out.

7) We do not accept instant bookings from residents of the Chicago metropolitan area as identified by profile city or phone number area code. If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans

8) Our favorite restaurant in Chicago is La Scarola.

Privacy Statement on the Use of Security Cameras:
We respect and value the privacy of our guests. We will never place a camera inside a living space. While Airbnb policy allows cameras in spaces that are not used for sleeping or bathing, we disagree. Cameras should be banned from inside all living spaces. Footage should be automatically deleted. Everything should be disclosed in advance. We use hallway security cameras to verify the number of guests who have entered an apartment. This is useful for stopping parties, and under additional prices extra guest charges may apply for extra people sleeping over.  All footage is deleted automatically after a stay, unless there is an open resolution center case. Itâ€™s unfortunate that not every guest is honest about their intentions, and our community would not allow us to be on Airbnb if we did not prevent unwanted behaviors. Let us know if you have questions. We have nothing to hide.

access:
The entire apartment is yours during your stay! You will not share with anyone else outside of your group!

The building does not have any common amenities.
description:
Sleep on the downtown-leaning edge of Chicago's ultra-hip Wicker Park neighborhood! Step out your front door to the Blue Line L train - 2 minute walk to the station! Front door to downtown in 10 minutes! This studio apartment, located in a brand-new building, offers two king beds, beautiful full bathroom, kitchen with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances,  in-unit washer/dryer, walk-in closet and more - perfect for your city home base!

Want advice? Looking for that local knowledge? We've got a guidebook telling you all the secrets! We're from Chicago. We live here. We know the place, and we have an opinion!

This studio apartment offers...
- TWO KING BEDS sleeping FOUR guests plus walk-in closet
-1 TWIN rollaway bed in the walk in closet
- FULL KITCHEN with stainless steel appliances including DISHWASHER, pots and pans, tableware, glassware and silverware provided, plus a wealth of coffee options and equipment, including French press and drip machine, ground AND whole bean coffee, sweeteners and half/half
- FULL BATHROOM with stand up glass door and stonewalled shower
- IN-UNIT WASHER DRYER
- High speed WiFi and TV with local channels and either Roku or FireTV
- Walk-in closet

-----------
PARKING
There's a parking lot around the corner which you can book in advance on an app.  It doesn't get much easier than that in Chicago.  Street parking is hard to find and not recommended.
----------
CHECK-IN TIME 
Typically, guests may receive the keys and drop their bags in the apartment as early as 12PM (noon). The cleaners do need until 4PM to do their work, and the apartment may be dirty anytime until 4.  
If you'd like to drop your bags early and head out until the cleaners finish, we can usually accommodate you! If you'd like to take a nap or shower right away, and the night before your stay isn't booked yet, let's discuss booking that night before! Then you could arrive as early as you'd like that day! 
----------
CHECK-OUT TIME
11AM is check-out. If you'll need a check-out after 11AM, and the night after your stay isn't booked yet, let's chat about booking that next night! Then you could leave as late as you'd like that day!
----------
LUGGAGE STORAGE
Need luggage storage the morning of check-in or the afternoon of check-out?
We have a locker in a storage unit a ten-minute walk away! (It's .2 miles, just across a couple of stoplights!) Details provided the day before arrival.
----------
OCCUPANCY 
Upon booking, your reservation will have paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number whether visiting or sleeping,  you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 
We consider the maximum capacity of the apartment to be its sleeping capacity - FOUR individuals. Anyone past four would not be permitted. 
Enjoy the city! Please donâ€™t bring a party back.
----------
RATES
Rates and minimum stays change constantly - every night is different! 
The nightly rate changes based on number of guests, which is verified upon arrival. Please do your best to let me know how many guests will be staying in advance!

The entire apartment is yours during your stay! You will not share with anyone else outside of your group!

The building does not have any common amenities.

We love our guests! We are available to our guests! 
We text our guests most of what they need! 
...WE NEED A NUMBER TO REACH YOU AT! 
Please confirm your phone number and email address upon booking.

IF YOU WILL NOT HAVE A US PHONE NUMBER, we ask that you download the Whats App phone texting app. We also have We Chat - please provide your ID!

WICKER PARK! 
The apartment is located right on Milwaukee Avenue, the center of Chicago's hipster haven! This awesome neighborhood has so many bars, restaurants, independent coffee joints and quirky shops you'll have no idea where to start - until you check out our curated guidebook! We'll give you a taste for starters.

CHEESIES, a casual bar up the street, has killer grilled cheese. The Popper is the best choice on the menu. We've only been after a few drinks, but we see people there all day. Good sign. 
EMPORIUM ARCADE BAR WICKER PARK is great for games and drinks. The cocktails are a little pricey, but you can play pinball for hours.  
PIECE PIZZA AND BREWERY has the best New Haven style pizza outside of Connecticut, and even better, it's not from New York! Their Hefeweizen is top notch, and they have live music all the time.
And at PODHALANKA you'll experience a Polish grandmother's welcome by stuffing you with blintzes, pierogies, and roast beef - and not taking 'please, no more' for an answer. 

Weâ€™ve got tips about hidden speakeasyâ€™s and burlesque shows, coffee shops and grab-and-go breakfast, high-end can't miss dinners, quick meals, late nights and boozy brunch, plus extensive day trips all throughout the city. We put our heart into it, and youâ€™ll find advice on other canâ€™t-miss places worth a train or Uber ride, including FIVE distinct nightlife districts throughout the city!

There's no need for a car here!
- You're a 2 minute walk from the Division Blue Line L train! 
7 minutes to downtown!
- INSTANTLY get an Uber or Lyft! This neighborhood has no waiting.

Take the CTA and go from front door to Chicago's... 

SELFIE SPOTS
- Millennium Park, the Bean (Cloud Gate), Maggie Daley Park: 18 min
- Riverwalk: 18 min
- Sears Tower / Willis Tower (Skydeck Chicago): 20 min
- Magnificent Mile / Michigan Avenue shopping, Hancock Center (360 Chicago), Water Tower: 29 min
- Lake Michigan, Oak Street Beach (terrific skyline view): 20 min

WORLD-CLASS CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS

house_rules:
1) The entire property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySensÂ® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $500 and asked to leave.

2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first.

3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one way or another, the apartment must be quiet.

4) Parties, events, and commercial activity are not allowed.

5) We reserve the right to ask you to leave without a refund if any of the above rules are broken.

6) Lost keys will incur a $100 charge. We have to change the locks. Please use the app to send a picture of all the keys at check-in AND check-out.

7) We do not accept instant bookings from residents of the Chicago metropolitan area as identified by profile city or phone number area code. If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans

8) Our favorite restaurant in Chicago is La Scarola.

Privacy Statement on the Use of Security Cameras:
We respect and value the privacy of our guests. We will never place a camera inside a living space. While Airbnb policy allows cameras in spaces that are not used for sleeping or bathing, we disagree. Cameras should be banned from inside all living spaces. Footage should be automatically deleted. Everything should be disclosed in advance. We use hallway security cameras to verify the number of guests who have entered an apartment. This is useful for stopping parties, and under additional prices extra guest charges may apply for extra people sleeping over.  All footage is deleted automatically after a stay, unless there is an open resolution center case. Itâ€™s unfortunate that not every guest is honest about their intentions, and our community would not allow us to be on Airbnb if we did not prevent unwanted behaviors. Let us know if you have questions. We have nothing to hide.
interaction:
We love our guests! We are available to our guests! 
We text our guests most of what they need! 
...WE NEED A NUMBER TO REACH YOU AT! 
Please confirm your phone number and email address upon booking.

IF YOU WILL NOT HAVE A US PHONE NUMBER, we ask that you download the Whats App phone texting app. We also have We Chat - please provide your ID!
neighborhood_overview:
WICKER PARK! 
The apartment is located right on Milwaukee Avenue, the center of Chicago's hipster haven! This awesome neighborhood has so many bars, restaurants, independent coffee joints and quirky shops you'll have no idea where to start - until you check out our curated guidebook! We'll give you a taste for starters.

CHEESIES, a casual bar up the street, has killer grilled cheese. The Popper is the best choice on the menu. We've only been after a few drinks, but we see people there all day. Good sign. 
EMPORIUM ARCADE BAR WICKER PARK is great for games and drinks. The cocktails are a little pricey, but you can play pinball for hours.  
PIECE PIZZA AND BREWERY has the best New Haven style pizza outside of Connecticut, and even better, it's not from New York! Their Hefeweizen is top notch, and they have live music all the time.
And at PODHALANKA you'll experience a Polish grandmother's welcome by stuffing you with blintzes, pierogies, and roast beef - and not taking 'please, no more' for an answer. 

Weâ€™ve got tips about hidden speakeasyâ€™s and burlesque shows, coffee shops and grab-and-go breakfast, high-end can't miss dinners, quick meals, late nights and boozy brunch, plus extensive day trips all throughout the city. We put our heart into it, and youâ€™ll find advice on other canâ€™t-miss places worth a train or Uber ride, including FIVE distinct nightlife districts throughout the city!

space:
Want advice? Looking for that local knowledge? We've got a guidebook telling you all the secrets! We're from Chicago. We live here. We know the place, and we have an opinion!

This studio apartment offers...
- TWO KING BEDS sleeping FOUR guests plus walk-in closet
-1 TWIN rollaway bed in the walk in closet
- FULL KITCHEN with stainless steel appliances including DISHWASHER, pots and pans, tableware, glassware and silverware provided, plus a wealth of coffee options and equipment, including French press and drip machine, ground AND whole bean coffee, sweeteners and half/half
- FULL BATHROOM with stand up glass door and stonewalled shower
- IN-UNIT WASHER DRYER
- High speed WiFi and TV with local channels and either Roku or FireTV
- Walk-in closet

-----------
PARKING
There's a parking lot around the corner which you can book in advance on an app.  It doesn't get much easier than that in Chicago.  Street parking is hard to find and not recommended.
----------
CHECK-IN TIME 
Typically, guests may receive the keys and drop their bags in the apartment as early as 12PM (noon). The cleaners do need until 4PM to do their work, and the apartment may be dirty anytime until 4.  
If you'd like to drop your bags early and head out until the cleaners finish, we can usually accommodate you! If you'd like to take a nap or shower right away, and the night before your stay isn't booked yet, let's discuss booking that night before! Then you could arrive as early as you'd like that day! 
----------
CHECK-OUT TIME
11AM is check-out. If you'll need a check-out after 11AM, and the night after your stay isn't booked yet, let's chat about booking that next night! Then you could leave as late as you'd like that day!
----------
LUGGAGE STORAGE
Need luggage storage the morning of check-in or the afternoon of check-out?
We have a locker in a storage unit a ten-minute walk away! (It's .2 miles, just across a couple of stoplights!) Details provided the day before arrival.
----------
OCCUPANCY 
Upon booking, your reservation will have paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number whether visiting or sleeping,  you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 
We consider the maximum capacity of the apartment to be its sleeping capacity - FOUR individuals. Anyone past four would not be permitted. 
Enjoy the city! Please donâ€™t bring a party back.
----------
RATES
Rates and minimum stays change constantly - every night is different! 
The nightly rate changes based on number of guests, which is verified upon arrival. Please do your best to let me know how many guests will be staying in advance!
summary: Sleep on the downtown-leaning edge of Chicago's ultra-hip Wicker Park neighborhood! Step out your front door to the Blue Line L train - 2 minute walk to the station! Front door to downtown in 10 minutes! This studio apartment, located in a brand-new building, offers two king beds, beautiful full bathroom, kitchen with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances,  in-unit washer/dryer, walk-in closet and more - perfect for your city home base!

description:
This is a beautiful and large one bedroom in the heart of downtown Hyde Park. Bedroom is located within a three bedroom townhouse that belonged to a University of Chicago nuclear chemist.  Family has preserved all books, furniture, and paintings which makes for a very historical experience in Hyde Park.  Steps away from the lake, beach, University of Chicago, and President Obama's house. Location is superb.

This is a beautiful and large bedroom located within a historical town house in the heart of Hyde Park. Town house has a front and back entrance along with sufficient street parking. Bedroom has floor to ceiling windows and is equipped with all essentials including private bathroom within the bedroom, walk-in closet, and TV with Netflix.  Kitchen is equipped with all essentials and then some. Home is located two block walking distance from President Obama's home, 15 minute walking distance from the well-known Harper Court and Harper Movie Theatre, 15 minute walking distance to Promontory point and 57th street Beach, and a ten minute walk main University of Chicago campus.

CTA
Beach access few blocks away
Divvy Bike Sharing
Zip Car rental on the block
Wireless internet 
Washer and dryer in basement
Metra train located three blocks away
Walking distance to the Museum of Science and Industry 
Tons of boutiques and restaurants just steps away

I will meet you upon arrival to show you the home and local community. I am currently a student and also take care of my two young daughters every other day and will also be reachable by phone for any questions or concerns.

It is in the heart of University of Chicago with such an incredible level of culture, diversity, and architecture. Home is located two block walking distance from President Obama's home, 15 minute walking distance from the well-known Harper Court and Harper Movie Theatre, 15 minute walking distance to Promontory point and 57th street Beach, and a ten minute walk main University of Chicago campus.  Everything you need is at hand, grocery stores, vintage bookstores, ice cream shops, movie theatre, and a local farmerâ€™s market.

Guests are expected to treat the apartment as they would an aunt's or their mother's friend's house.  ( I hesitate to say your own friend's house, because, personally, I'm never particularly well-behaved at my good friends' houses.  Especially while on vacation.)

The agreed upon number of guests is the limit.  If someone stops by for a glass of wine, it's no big deal. But, no parties, etc. There are plenty of places nearby for loud group revelry.

Shoes should come off in the apartment. This is not a cleanliness issue; I'm not worried about little messes, etc.  But, shoes sound like thunder to the apartment dweller below.

If something breaks, it's not a big deal.  I won't leave anything out that you'll need to worry about.  But, if it happens, please do let me know.

access: You'll have the full apartment!
description:
Have you been hearing about the new "restaurant row" in Chicago's Logan Square? Stay steps away from culinary greatness in this warm and sun-drenched apartment.

This spacious one-bedroom apartment includes a relatively new Casper queen-sized mattress. The large living room includes a comfortable couch for an additional sleeper, as well as a daybed. 

A block from the California Blue Line stop, you'll be able to shuffle downtown in mere minutes.  The booming Logan Square restaurant and bar scene is a short walk from the front door.  Or, lounge in the sun-filled living room, use the desk and wi-fi to catch up on work, or sip some lemonade on the cute back deck.  

Street parking is almost never a problem, though it is getting trickier in the evening. Also! Portions of the street ARE permit only--keep an eye out. If you'd like to increase your parking options by using daily permits, please let me know. If so, please familiarize yourself with permit use: https://www.chicityclerk.com/city-stickers-parking/about-parking-permits

This classic Chicago apartment will enhance your Chicago experience, as will the paintings and prints by local artists that line the walls.  

The building is charming and well kept, but it is over 100 yrs old. Sometimes the water lightens for a second (though it's never cold), and sometimes, you must open the windows, because the radiators have worked too well (not a bad problem to have).  The living room and the bedroom each have AC window units, though the kitchen can get warm in the summer. The apartment also gets a great breeze, because the backdoor opens onto the top (3rd) floor balcony.  It's true--they don't build them like they used to: you will rarely hear the neighbors. However! Please remove shoes and be careful when dropping bags. The floor does amplify sound to the person below.

The pets will need to stay home (allergies), but children could be discussed. Also, small groups could be discussed. The apartment could--and has--worked well for a friends weekend, etc. There's no smoking in the apartment, but you could smoke on the back deck.

There are many shelves of books that you are welcome to dive into during your stay. If you wanted the opportunity to discover new Chicago writers or catch up on some contemporary fiction, it will be available to you.

The apartment has a full kitchen with everything you need to make meals. A coffee maker and grinder are also provided.  There is a kettle for tea.  

Just a couple blocks from the apartment is Palmer Square Park, and it's a great place to jog or walk --there's a path that circles it.  There's also a small playground, if you do have a child.

This is a third floor apartmentâ€”the very top floor. You'll find a little bouquet on the door. 

*Only those with full profiles will be considered.*

You'll have the full apartment!

I'll be available for any questions you might have. Texting is the best way to reach me.

Logan Square is the hottest Chicago neighborhood right now. I didn't make this up.

The apartment is a very short walk to the California stop on the Blue Line. Additionally, there are scores of restaurants and bars within walking distance.

If something breaks, it's not a big deal.  I won't leave anything out that you'll need to worry about.  But, if it happens, please do let me know.

additional_house_rules:
HOUSE RULES

Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking:

-No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250).
-If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair.
- The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.
-Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Lost key fee - $300
-Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc.
-Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc.
-Smoking - $300
-Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300



**-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

access: Please make yourself at home in this gorgeous apartment; our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level.
description:
Welcome to Chicago! Home of the World Series Champs, the Cubs. Our large 1-bedroom/1-bath condo is just 1 mile from Wrigley Field and is ideal for any Chicago getaway. It features a full kitchen, a private bedroom, and conveniences like a full kitchen and fast WiFi. 

Metered parking is available nearby, but it gets more difficult to park at night. I recommend taking the train for your entire stay. The closest train station is Paulina-Lincoln/Roscoe Station, just a 3-min walk away.

Illuminated by sunny natural light, our studio features Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units.

The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. Weâ€™re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say thereâ€™s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower!

Thereâ€™s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, youâ€™ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. The entire place has free, fast WiFi and Chicago sunshine streaming in through the windows.

Whether youâ€™re craving a home-cooked meal or just somewhere to put the box of deep-dish, our kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, utensils, and has swanky granite countertops. Appliances include a full-sized fridge and freezer, gas stove, oven, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. The only things missing are your favorite farmerâ€™s market finds!!

Please make yourself at home in this gorgeous apartment; our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level.

Just west of Chicagoâ€™s hip Lake View neighborhood and steps from the Paulina-Lincoln/Roscoe L Station, our residential location is the perfect place to relax and recharge on any trip to vibrant Chicago.

Here youâ€™ll find cozy restaurants, low-key bars, eclectic boutiques, and all the essentials for a comfortable stay. Thereâ€™s a Target just 5 minutes away on foot (home of things you never knew you needed), several banks, a Whole Foods Market, and a variety of exercise options including a YMCA, Pure Barre, and Core Power Yoga all within a couple of blocks.

If youâ€™re coming to town for a Cubs game, thereâ€™s no need pack into the train like sardines with hundreds of other Cubs fans - weâ€™re just 1 mile from Wrigley Field, and walking is a nice way to stretch your legs before or after a game.

But thatâ€™s not the only attraction (besides Target) thatâ€™s accessible on foot from our place; youâ€™ll find a plethora of fantastic places to eat and drink just minutes away. Donâ€™t miss the exquisite pastries from Loba Pastry + Coffee or the German delicacies from Dinkel's Bakery - both excellent ways to start the day.

In the mood for tacos? Head to Cafe El Tapatio for authentic Mexican eats. Or dig into some spicy curry or noodles at Thai Thank You (pro tip: itâ€™s BYOB). And pizza never disappoints, especially when itâ€™s from Pizzeria Serio. Wash it all down with a cold treat from Scooter's Frozen Custard or Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams, and youâ€™ve got a memorable eating experience.


When youâ€™re searching for souvenirs or some retail therapy, walk over to Southport Avenue, where youâ€™ll find shops selling everything from cosmetics to beer to sneakers. Only brought a carry on? Maybe skip the shops and head to Southport Lanes & Billiards, where you can play old-school billiards and try your hand at bowling. Or, if youâ€™re up for a walk, take the Brown line to Belmont Station and walk 15 minutes to the Lakefront Trail for stunning views of Lake Michigan.

Why splurge on an expensive rental car when you can take advantage of Chicagoâ€™s great public transportation system? Our place is just a 3-minute walk from Paulina-Lincoln/Roscoe Station, where you can catch the Brown Line train. The Brown Line will take you south to Downtown Chicago in just about 15 minutes, or you can head north to Uptown or Evanston when you transfer to the Red Line at Belmont Station.

Flying into Chicago? Weâ€™re a 20-minute drive from Oâ€™Hare when there is no traffic, but if there is traffic you may be better off taking public transit (and saving some $$ on the taxi or Uber fare). Take the Blue Line from Oâ€™Hare to Belmont & Kimball, then transfer to the #77 bus and ride for about 15 minutes to Belmont & Paulina.

In addition to public transit, ridesharing (Uber or Lyft) is also a great way to get around the Chicago metro. When youâ€™re heading out with a group or want that extra little bit of luxury, just request a ride - theyâ€™re readily available and can take you anywhere you want to go.

-There are many units inside this building.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

Feel free to request to add more guest before 12 pm on checkin date.

$100.00 fee. 

If you register for less than 4 guest and bring more than the registered number of guest, each additional guest will receive the additional guest fee.  

I.e. you will forfeit the remaining three free guests.  All guest over the registered amount will count as an additional guest.  

Do not have unregistered guests after midnight. 

- Absoutely no children on the outside Deck without adult supervision.

-No Smoking on the Deck.  Guest must go outside to the alley to smoke.  

- Smoke-free building. ($350.00 fine if violated and may cause you and your guest to be escorted from the premises.)

access:
Guest access
Entire house. Self-Check in with August Smart Lock.
description:
*55" 4K HDTV's with Netflix, Hulu, Roku --Apple TV and Cable in Living Room,
1 King, 2 Queen, 2 twin, 1 rollaway, 1 floor mattress. 
High-quality printer, *Desk, *Glass White Board, *
Pack n Play, Baby tub, high chair 
*Central Air/Heat *Coin OP  Washer/Dryer *2 Parking Spaces  *
 *Fully Equipped Kitchen *Coffee,  *Toiletries
* Near infrared. Sauna Sessions  available upon request.

Imagine staying in an Immaculate, Beautiful relaxing home, without the bother of house keeping knocking on your door disturbing your rest.  We have designed our home for those that like to feel at home when they are away from home.  We offer a fully stocked kitchen with plenty of dishes, silverware, pots, pans, and a coffee maker.  Based upon limited kitchen cabinets, we store some of our pots in the oven.  We want our guest to feel as if they are coming to their second home in Chicago.

***** ONE NIGHT STAY AVAILABLE *****
Please inquire with the host.  

This is a 3 bedroom home.  There are 21 enclosed stairs to the top floor.  The stairs are separated in the equal sets of 7.  There is a landing after each set of stairs.  One bedroom has a King Sized bed, One bedroom has a Queen sized bed, Last bedroom has Extra beds. If available each Bed room can be rented separately, but the entire home can also be booked. There are  2 bath rooms.

 *********      EVERY ONE LOVES THE SHOWER!!!!!!   *********

Guest access
Entire house. Self-Check in with August Smart Lock.

Once you have completed your booking with us, you will receive: * Welcome email * Within the week of your arrival, you will receive another message with detailed step by step instructions on how to get to the property, self- check in and parking instructions * We will periodically send a message to ensure that your needs are met * We are more than happy to answer your questions before, during and after your trip, as well as provide helpful information that will create the ultimate experience for your stay, should you wish to reach out to us. * However, the apartment is all yours and you will be undisturbed unless you contact us for assistance.

This is a family-friendly neighborhood where children still play outside. It has one of the lowest crime rates within the city of Chicago. We are close to Midway Airport.

Please park in the 2 guest spaces located in the back of the building next to the chained fence. Do not park in any of the other spaces or your car may be towed at owners expense. Street parking is available very close to the apartment. We are .4 miles to bus service and 3 blocks to the I 55 Expressway. You may also contact Uber--our code will be sent to you in the welcome message.

Please make sure you check house rules and cancellation policy.

Be sure to reference your welcome packet in the apartment upon arrival for helpful tips to enhance your stay in our place. House Rule: * No Smoking * No Pets * Absolutely No Parties or Events * Check-in time is 4 PM * Do not have more guests than stated in your reservation( Extra fees will be assessed if you do (children under 5 do not count as guests)) * No loud music * No disturbances, especially noise past 10 PM

 *Guest that books must be one of the people staying in the unit unless we have given written permission otherwise .  All guests must be registered.  

We may request valid government ID for anyone that book with our home.  

If you instant book and do not provide ID/IDâ€™S  for all guest or register you will not receive entry instructions until IDâ€™s are provided and registration is complete.

The booking Guest must be 21 years or older.  No third party bookings are allowed. 

If police are called to the home based upon guest behavior the guests may be accessed a fine up to $500.00 and civil  charges may be filed against the guests and other occupants.  


****	DO NOT PARK IN NEIGHBORS PARKING SPACE OR CAR MAYBE TOWED AT OWNERS EXPENSE.**** Parking instructions in the welcome message. * We are not responsible or liable for any accidents, injuries or illness that occur while on the premises. * We are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables during your stay. * We cannot be responsible for any items left behind. $350.00 Fine for smoking in the home.


BONUS****
Our ground-breaking rain shower system provides a dynamic shower experience by using proprietary technology to provide amplified power

The large face creates complete coverage so you're never left in the cold

The 6 unique settings well help you craft the perfect shower, every time

New technology extends 8.5" from your shower arm, increasing your shower height by 4"

Wireless speaker allows for listening to music and answering phone calls while in the shower

description:
Great LINCOLN Park/Old Town location. Walk to brown line and red line. Walk to LINCOLN Park and Lake Michigan. Best and safest neighborhood in Chicago. The room has a full bed and there is an air mattress available on request.

Hardwood floors, washer and dryer in unit, back patio, full kitchen, internet, Netflix, walking distance to LINCOLN Park and Lake Michigan. Walking distance to over 50 bars and restaurants.  Walking distance to CVS and local grocery store. Extremely safe neighborhood and awesome host.

WiFi, Netflix, washer and dryer, full kitchen, back patio and parking can easily be arranged at no extra charge.

As needed.  My goal is for them to enjoy the city.

Lincoln Park/Old town is the best neighborhood in Chicago. Wrigley field is 2 miles away. Chicago-360 is 1.6 miles away. Grocery store and drug store 1 block away. Walking distance to over 50 bars and restaurants.

Red line and brown line are less than a mile away. Bus stop right near the corner of the street and Uber is everywhere.  Parking can be arranged at no extra cost.

Please contact me if parking is needed. It can be arranged.

access: You get the whole house to yourself! As much as I would love to meet you. Most people enjoy their privacy, so I give you the guidebook right after you book. Which gives you pictures of the garage, entrance, and everything around the unit and around the city. Pretty easy. :) Then the day of your trip i send you a 4 digit code for access to the unit, and voila, everything is setup for you and your guests. :D
description:
Location. âœ“ Quality. âœ“ Price. âœ“  Comfort. âœ“ Parking. âœ“

What you get?  Hotel quality beds, TV, full kitchen, full patio and grill, 7 beds, Full House to yourself, Ez "Self Checking", Centered location, personal recommendations, and an easy to use guidebook an instructions once you book. We have all the towels, kitchen utensils needed for a long term stay. We even have some baby friendly amenities if requested. We also added a SNES classic with 30 games, and by March we will have the place full of Chicago Trivia and Facts, and more themed rooms!

Layout: We have 7 Beds in this unit. One room has a top of the line GreenTea Memory foam King mattress, with a nart deco theme. Another room has two queen size beds and a comfy memory foam pullout as well. Living room has couch plus 2 memory foam pullouts via the daybed in the living room. And an extra pullout if needed. :) 

Location: We are located in West Lakeview, which is a centered location, and pretty much 10 minutes away from anything  you want in the city. We are 5 minutes from Wrigley. 10 second walk from the best Cuban in town. And we have all the food shopping you could want in walking distance. Perfect for families and long stays. :) Also this location is VERY safe. A lot of schools, people walking dogs, and a very charming neighborhood vibe if that is important to you.

Parking: Don't be fooled, Chicago is AMAZING, no doubt about that. But because of that parking can be a nightmare, with up to $60 a day parking. Luckily we have one of the best blocks in the city, because our block is FREE to park on. So you even with 2-3 cars, they can all park safely and easily. :) 

This place goes fast! We won't be beat, found a comparable place with a good location and amount of beds? Maybe I can try and price match for you. Want to stay over 7 days, shoot me a message, I'll see what I can do. :D

The Pictures should do most the talking, but again. 

2 Beds in Living Room, 3 Beds in Extra large room, 1 King in Master. Full Bathroom, Dining Room, Kitchen, and Patio with Grill.

You get the whole house to yourself! As much as I would love to meet you. Most people enjoy their privacy, so I give you the guidebook right after you book. Which gives you pictures of the garage, entrance, and everything around the unit and around the city. Pretty easy. :) Then the day of your trip i send you a 4 digit code for access to the unit, and voila, everything is setup for you and your guests. :D

You get the whole house to yourself! As much as I would love to meet you. Most people enjoy their privacy, so I give you the guidebook right after you book. Which gives you pictures of the garage, entrance, and everything around the unit and around the city. Pretty easy. :) Then the day of your trip i send you a 4 digit code for access to the unit, and voila, everything is setup for you and your guests. :D

Again, very safe, very family friendly. And plenty to walk to. It's Lakeview, pretty much centered. :)

I recommend Uber/lyft to all my guests. reason being, the train/bus cost $2.50-$3.00 per person. Which is pretty much the same you'd pay with Lyft. And on top of that, you'll save precious hours, which is the most important thing on this trip, because who know's when you'll be back to this amazing city.

Due note like all apartments, you'll probably hear some slight noise above during day hours. 

The no Party rule, helps me keep booking amazing 5 star guests and families, and helps the other 5 star guests and families feel safe that others in the neighboring units are highly qualified guests. :) 

Winter Season Discount in session! 70% off. 

Note All Locals Chicago/Illinois guest must inquire before booking to go over our no party no exception rules. Most our units have cameras that monitor for extra guests/parties and it's a $500 fee and we call police if rules are violated. This is to protect our other guests/neighbors who are near/around the unit. We are a pro Family/Tourist unit and we respect quiet hours for everyones enjoyment. :D

Our beautiful apartment sits just off Michigan Avenue in a sleek glass building.  Wood floors, floor-to-ceiling windows, and granite everywhere.  Rooftop hot tub included. additional_house_rules:
As a fellow traveler I am so happy and excited to welcome people to my home. This is a safe, clean and inexpensive way to really enjoy the city on more than just the surface level of downtown, which (lets be honest) real Chicagoans almost never visit. All I ask is that you treat my place with respect and the way you would want a guest to treat your home. Along with a clean and comfortable space to stay, I am able to provide the following: Free parking (it's not covered) but does not require permit, high speed internet (wifi does not require a password). Clean towels, sheets and shampoo/conditioner. Washer and dryer. HBO go, Roku box, Netflix and a variety of movies and books. 

Extra charges for the following:

Flat fee of $25 for pets (no more than 2 please)

Flat fee of $25 if you would like to check in before 3pmâ€¦ If you want to come in like 30 mins earlier and if I am able to accommodate you, I will (no charge)

Flat fee of $25 If you want to stay later. I ask people â€œcheck out" by 11am, if you plan on staying later you are welcome to stay till 3pm for the extra fee, but this needs to be arranged before hand. Please do not ask to stay later the morning of check out, its just not cool.

Flat fee of $10 if you would like leave bags after you have â€œchecked out" of my place. So if you have a later flight and want to continue exploring city without the hassle of pulling your suitcase around, you are welcome to. But this needs to be arranged before hand. 

I am more than willing to accommodate you, so long as you communicate what is needed prior to arrival. Please let me know when and how you will be to getting to Chicago so that I am able to assist with directions on how to get to my place, don't take a cab from the airport. I am a flight attendant and work out of Ohare airport, so I can send you a list of instructions on the easiest and most cost effective options of getting to my home or anywhere else in the city.

access: Gym down stairs open 24 hours
description:
My "cozy" (tiny) north side city studio is a no frills but everything you need for long or short stay. It's conveniently located near CTA Red line with easy access to get you downtown,  4 blocks to park and beach. Space is unique, simple and efficient. Free STREET parking (no reserved spot), has washer & dryer in the unit. Fully equipped kitchen and LOFTED full size bed. I do my best to keep pricing fair so if you are a "fussy" traveler I kindly encourage you to find a hotel.

My studio is equipped with in-unit laundry, 24 hour gym, wifi through out building, you won't find much like it for the price. Parking on my street is free and easy, there is no permit required. Unit is small so works best for 1-2 people.

Gym down stairs open 24 hours

I make an effort to meet as many of my guests as I possibly can before handing over keys, but sometimes scheduling can be hectic, so if I'm unable to meet guests I will give  thorough instructions for arrival/departure. My main concern is that my guests arrive safely.

This is one of the coolest neighborhoods in Chicago. Historically a very popular tourist destination, the Uptown Square at the center of the Uptown Entertainment District which is home to various music venues, nightclubs, restaurants and shops. The Uptown Entertainment District is now experiencing a revival, with new restaurants and shops opening every year. Uptown is also a stop for Chicago Gangster tours, with many locations tied to infamous gangsters such as John Dillinger, Al Capone, Machine Gun Jack McGurn, Roger Touhy ("Terrible Touhy") and others.

I am 2 blocks from the redline. I would advise against renting a car if you are visiting, there is just no reason. Train and most buses run 24 hours a day 7 days a week. If you do drive, street parking here is easy and free. Also my place is about a 10-15 minute walk to the lake and there are more divvy bikes stations than you can shake a stick at, but why would you shake a stick at a bike station; that's dumb.

No smoking. You wouldn't think I would need to write this but I guess it needs to be said, so no smoking or you will not get your security deposit back. Simple as that.

access: You have free reign to almost  anything in the place (my only request is for you to leave be the wine on the rack), mi casa es su casa.  Enjoy the fully stocked bar with numerous rare spirits and a few cocktail books to try your hand at making a superlative night cap.  There's a large hi-fi in the main room if you want to peruse the record collection or bump some jams via bluetooth.  Tired from your day running around town?  Kick back and relax while watching some flicks using the projector on the 101" screen.   Feel free to fiddle with the Nest Thermostat if you need to get the temperature indoors just right.
description:
Wicker/Buck stands for the Wicker Park/Bucktown border where the apartments sits.  Five minute walk from Blue Line trains (transfer-free travel to downtown and O'Hare Airport), nationally-acclaimed drinking/dining, The 606 bike/walk trail, and interesting boutiques.  Street parking is permitted (I have day passes for your use) and plentiful.

Queen-sized Leesa mattress, organic linens, an open bar, and Baxter shower products provided for your use.

Two bed room apartment with tall ceilings, loads of light, and my bizarre collection of trinkets from travels across the globe.  One bedroom is for my use, the other bedroom is for you.  There is a deck out back with a loveseat and other seating and a table that is a great way to spend the golden hour.  The apartment has central heating and A/C controlled via a Nest Thermostat and feel free to use the WiFi.  I have a large collection of books, magazines, records for you to peruse during your time at what my friends affectionately call Hambone Manor.

Your room features a full length mirror, plush towels, a full closet, and underbed storage. Other in-room amenities are a hair dryer, a white noise machine, and a fire extinguisher.

Best of all, you may have the whole place to yourself.  I travel for work often, and am occasionally called away at the last moment.  While I'm certain you will enjoy having the place to yourself, should you have any questions I remain available and I have former residents and siblings on-call who are well-versed in how the apartment works and troubleshooting any difficulties you might have.

You have free reign to almost  anything in the place (my only request is for you to leave be the wine on the rack), mi casa es su casa.  Enjoy the fully stocked bar with numerous rare spirits and a few cocktail books to try your hand at making a superlative night cap.  There's a large hi-fi in the main room if you want to peruse the record collection or bump some jams via bluetooth.  Tired from your day running around town?  Kick back and relax while watching some flicks using the projector on the 101" screen.   Feel free to fiddle with the Nest Thermostat if you need to get the temperature indoors just right.

I'm available for questions 24/7 via phone but I tend to lead a pretty active lifestyle, the result of which is I'm not home much.  

I'm also a big coffee (though come summer it is mostly iced coffee) and matcha drinker and will be happy to make a cup or two for you if you let me know the night prior.

See the note in "The Space" section regarding how I may have to delegate some issues you encounter to my siblings or pals.

Bucktown/Wicker Park is a pretty happening spot.  All spots listed are less than a ten minute walk from the apartment unless otherwise noted:

For food and drink many of Eater's 38 essential restaurants are within walking distance and there are countless others that get lots of food press love (Paul Kahan's Big Star/Dove's Luncheonette/Cafe Cancale, Pub Royale, Piece Brewery and Pizzeria, Antique Taco, Stan's Doughnuts, The Delta, Small Cheval, Umami Burger, Le Bouchon, Craft Pizza, Furious Spoon, The Bristol).  

Beloved cocktail bar The Violet Hour is a short stumble away and iconic Chicago beer bar The Map Room is five minutes out by Divvy bike.  Stop by the Emporium Arcade Bar for a quality draft list and quality gaming.  For coffee check out the The Wormhole, Ipsento,  and La Colombe (The Wormhole has an entire Delorean inside of its relaxed environs and seriously impressive latte art).

Music venues within a five minute walk include The Subterranean and The Double Door.

Shop at the numerous stores on Damen and Milwaukee ranging for international brands to fun, independent boutiques.

Also, you are one block away from the newest Bucktown attraction, The 606.  The 606 is a 2.7 mile, $95 million trail/park that runs on an old freight track.  There are many places to sit and enjoy as well as numerous parks at entryways to the trails.  It's a great place to bike and walk even in winter.

There is free street parking that is well-lit, safe, and all around the apartment (I've never had to park more than two blocks away).  There is a Divvy bike-share station on the corner (Divvy is my primary form of transportation), the # 72 bus runs every ten minutes, the CTA's Blue Line is a five minute walk away, the Metra commuter rail is a 10 minute walk ), and there are cabs on North Avenue throughout the day (Uber/Lyft users can expect to have a car at the doorstep within five minutes 24 hours a day).  The apartment's close proximity to the highway means most fares to River North, Millennium Park or the Art Institute will run less than $15 on via ridesharing outside of rush hour traffic.

There is permitted street parking that is well-lit, safe, and generally close to the apartment.  There is a Divvy bike-share stations one, four, and six blocks away (Divvy is my primary form of transportation), the # 72 bus to Red Line trains runs every ten minutes just down the street on North Avenue, the CTA's Damen stop for Blue Line trains is a five minute walk away, the Metra commuter rail is a 10 minute walk, and there are cabs on North Avenue throughout the day (Uber/Lyft users can expect to have a car at the doorstep within five minutes 24 hours a day).  Download the Transit app to see the cost, directions, and time commitment for all the different modes of transit in one place.

I have a very early checkout to allow myself the time necessary to turn the room around and get to work on-time.  I'm totally flexible if there are no other guests arriving the day of your departure, and stashing bags in the living room (no matter if you're arriving early or departing late) is not a problem in the slightest.
house_rules: Please try to pick up after yourselves by placing cups and dishes in the sink so I can clean them.   If you plan on bringing friends old or new by, that's a-okay if you ask in advance.  Smokers please use the patio. Leave the keys on the table where you found them on the way out (don't worry about bolting the door).  Please leave the door to your room slightly ajar when you're not around to let the airflow in and so I know I do not have to tiptoe around to avoid disturbing you.
interaction:
I'm available for questions 24/7 via phone but I tend to lead a pretty active lifestyle, the result of which is I'm not home much.  

I'm also a big coffee (though come summer it is mostly iced coffee) and matcha drinker and will be happy to make a cup or two for you if you let me know the night prior.

See the note in "The Space" section regarding how I may have to delegate some issues you encounter to my siblings or pals.
neighborhood_overview:
Bucktown/Wicker Park is a pretty happening spot.  All spots listed are less than a ten minute walk from the apartment unless otherwise noted:

For food and drink many of Eater's 38 essential restaurants are within walking distance and there are countless others that get lots of food press love (Paul Kahan's Big Star/Dove's Luncheonette/Cafe Cancale, Pub Royale, Piece Brewery and Pizzeria, Antique Taco, Stan's Doughnuts, The Delta, Small Cheval, Umami Burger, Le Bouchon, Craft Pizza, Furious Spoon, The Bristol).  

Beloved cocktail bar The Violet Hour is a short stumble away and iconic Chicago beer bar The Map Room is five minutes out by Divvy bike.  Stop by the Emporium Arcade Bar for a quality draft list and quality gaming.  For coffee check out the The Wormhole, Ipsento,  and La Colombe (The Wormhole has an entire Delorean inside of its relaxed environs and seriously impressive latte art).

Music venues within a five minute walk include The Subterranean and The Double Door.

Shop at the numerous stores on Damen and Milwaukee ranging for international brands to fun, independent boutiques.

Also, you are one block away from the newest Bucktown attraction, The 606.  The 606 is a 2.7 mile, $95 million trail/park that runs on an old freight track.  There are many places to sit and enjoy as well as numerous parks at entryways to the trails.  It's a great place to bike and walk even in winter.
notes:
There is permitted street parking that is well-lit, safe, and generally close to the apartment.  There is a Divvy bike-share stations one, four, and six blocks away (Divvy is my primary form of transportation), the # 72 bus to Red Line trains runs every ten minutes just down the street on North Avenue, the CTA's Damen stop for Blue Line trains is a five minute walk away, the Metra commuter rail is a 10 minute walk, and there are cabs on North Avenue throughout the day (Uber/Lyft users can expect to have a car at the doorstep within five minutes 24 hours a day).  Download the Transit app to see the cost, directions, and time commitment for all the different modes of transit in one place.

I have a very early checkout to allow myself the time necessary to turn the room around and get to work on-time.  I'm totally flexible if there are no other guests arriving the day of your departure, and stashing bags in the living room (no matter if you're arriving early or departing late) is not a problem in the slightest.
space:
Two bed room apartment with tall ceilings, loads of light, and my bizarre collection of trinkets from travels across the globe.  One bedroom is for my use, the other bedroom is for you.  There is a deck out back with a loveseat and other seating and a table that is a great way to spend the golden hour.  The apartment has central heating and A/C controlled via a Nest Thermostat and feel free to use the WiFi.  I have a large collection of books, magazines, records for you to peruse during your time at what my friends affectionately call Hambone Manor.

Your room features a full length mirror, plush towels, a full closet, and underbed storage. Other in-room amenities are a hair dryer, a white noise machine, and a fire extinguisher.

Best of all, you may have the whole place to yourself.  I travel for work often, and am occasionally called away at the last moment.  While I'm certain you will enjoy having the place to yourself, should you have any questions I remain available and I have former residents and siblings on-call who are well-versed in how the apartment works and troubleshooting any difficulties you might have.
summary:
Wicker/Buck stands for the Wicker Park/Bucktown border where the apartments sits.  Five minute walk from Blue Line trains (transfer-free travel to downtown and O'Hare Airport), nationally-acclaimed drinking/dining, The 606 bike/walk trail, and interesting boutiques.  Street parking is permitted (I have day passes for your use) and plentiful.

Queen-sized Leesa mattress, organic linens, an open bar, and Baxter shower products provided for your use.
transit: There is free street parking that is well-lit, safe, and all around the apartment (I've never had to park more than two blocks away).  There is a Divvy bike-share station on the corner (Divvy is my primary form of transportation), the # 72 bus runs every ten minutes, the CTA's Blue Line is a five minute walk away, the Metra commuter rail is a 10 minute walk ), and there are cabs on North Avenue throughout the day (Uber/Lyft users can expect to have a car at the doorstep within five minutes 24 hours a day).  The apartment's close proximity to the highway means most fares to River North, Millennium Park or the Art Institute will run less than $15 on via ridesharing outside of rush hour traffic.

access: Guests have access to our entire apartment, and none of the space is shared. There are tenants upstairs in the building so we ask our guests to be respectful.
description:
Welcome to our simple, classic, Chicago apartment. Our home has lots of character thanks to the original woodwork and cozy feel. Featuring 2 comfy queen beds, our home is great for business travelers, families, or small groups of friends looking to explore the city.

Our home is a first floor apartment in a small residential building on the west side of Chicago. Guests tell us that they love our antique woodwork, hardwood floors, comfy beds, and proximity to the Wicker Park and Ukrainian Village neighborhoods. Many guests have enjoyed watching a movie together on our large couch in the living room, or sharing a meal at the dining room table. We welcome travelers of all kinds to enjoy our apartment so their stay may be just a little more comfortable and feel a little more like home.

Guests have access to our entire apartment, and none of the space is shared. There are tenants upstairs in the building so we ask our guests to be respectful.

We have self check-in so you may come and go as you please, but we are always nearby if you have questions.

We love our location on Chicago's West Side. You aren't too far from downtown, but it's not quite so hectic as some other locales closer to the city. There is also a beautiful park nearby which is a great way to spend an afternoon!

There are buses that run nearby along Western Avenue and Division St.

additional_house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.

access: You'll have full access to the entire loft, plus the apartment's dedicated bathroom and building's laundry room.
description:
A renovated and professionally decorated loft in a building dating to the 1880s in Old Town is exactly where you want to stay during your trip to Chicago - the location is ideal for seeing everything you've got on your list: across the street from Second City, Steppenwolf, and Lincoln Park, and about 20 minutes' train ride from the Loop or Wrigley Field.

The loft's bathroom isn't shared, but it is a few steps down the hall. Also, one of the beds in my place is a top bunk - up a step ladder.

You'll have full access to the entire loft, plus the apartment's dedicated bathroom and building's laundry room.

An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

My place is a few minutes' walk away from the Sedgwick Brown/Purple line train station, and equally convenient to the North Ave and LaSalle buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, there are several garages nearby with overnight parking.

Loft Apt. Street parking, Sleeps two. Fridge, Coffee maker, Hot plate, Microwave, Bathroom with shower.  Awesome yard, Gas Grill available.
Des Plaines bike trail entrance 2 blocks away.  2 night minimum 
Walking distance to Bus &  Amtrak

Ride pickup & drop off from O'hare for additional fee.
Close to Train into City and bus line.

1/2 a block walk to  bus stop. 1/2 mile to Train station that goes to downtown Chicago.   Its about a 30 minute ride on the train.

Climbing steps to the loft are required

additional_house_rules:
When you book with us, you are agreeing to all of the following house rules:

1.  Please be respectful of upstairs neighbors.  Quiet hours are from 10pm-8am (weekdays) and 11pm-9am (weekends). Any noise complaints will result in a $50 charge.

2. If the apartment is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required.

3. There is absolutely NO SMOKING in the apartment.  Any smoking outside should be outside the black gates. Breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine.

4. Breaking anything in the apartment will mean that I will bill you for the damages.

5. Please put things back where they belong.  Clean up after yourself especially by putting garbage in garbage cans.

6. No glassware is allowed on the outside back deck.

7. Keep windows and exterior doors locked for safety.  Anyone that is reported by my tenants to have left any exterior doors open and/or unlocked will be given a warning and then a fine of $100, plus any other damages incurred as a result of theft.

8. Use the cover provided when using the microwave.

9. Lost key fee is $150 per key.  Lock out fee for exterior OR interior doors is $150 (that is if you leave your key in the unit and need to call me to let you back in). I do not have keys for interior doors that are locked.

10. At checkout, please hang all dirty towels on the over-the-door hooks in the bathrooms.

11. If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full.

12. If guests check out late, this delays the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time so guests will be charged $50. Guests who are still in the apartment after 12 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if we have approved a late checkout in advance.

13.  Please make sure to turn off the A/C or lower the heat setting to 60 degrees when you are leaving the unit (both to go out temporarily or for the final checkout) to help save energy and high utility bills.

14.  Please use coasters and placemats provided and wipe up spills promptly so as to not cause water marks and stains on wood tables.

Thank you for helping make your experience a great one!

access:
This reservation will give guests access to the first floor duplex down apartment, with two floors to themselves.

Ample, free street parking (watch for street cleaning signs). Free washer/dryer access available on lower level.
description:
Best of both worlds: quiet street to unwind & rest, yet walking distance to all that's happening in Wicker Park and Bucktown.  A 7-minute walk to the Damen Blue Line stop will get you to the Loop/downtown in 4 stops. Apartment is tastefully & eclectically decorated and works well for couples, families, singles, and business travelers.

This home away from home is in an apartment on the first floor that duplexes down and truly accommodates 10 people. Avail yourself to a dining table that actually seats 10 together. And we have four private bedrooms for four couples, plus a futon for two more people.

Three of the four bedrooms have a queen bed; one of the bedrooms has a full bed. The downstairs living room has a full size futon. 

Each of the two bathrooms has been gut rehabbed with a modern feel and Toto toilets. And the kitchen won't make you feel like you're in the 70s or 80s.

A full kitchen is open to you if you would like to cook. There is a living room and entertainment area as well as a separate dining room. The lower level has its own living room area.
 
In the spring, summer and fall, enjoy the rooftop deck over the garage. In the winter, enjoy heated floors on the lower level.

The spacious apartment is in a red brick building with a pear tree out front, on a quiet, residential street in arguably one of the hippest neighborhoods in the city.

This reservation will give guests access to the first floor duplex down apartment, with two floors to themselves.

Ample, free street parking (watch for street cleaning signs). Free washer/dryer access available on lower level.

We are very friendly, experienced and accessible hosts. We are always available to assist you in getting settled in, as well as sharing all that we love about the city. Also, if you have any pre-booking questions, let us know!

Ranked by Forbes as the "4th hippest neighborhood in the country," Wicker Park features a diverse nightlife, many of the city's top-rated and reasonably-priced restaurants, vibrant entertainment venues, chic independent boutique shops, and cool cafes. Just google "Chicago Wicker Park"!

Being native locals, we can help you live like a local while you're here with recommendations for eats in Wicker Park (or elsewhere in the city), how to get around the city and things to do in Chicago.

You'll be minutes from I-90/94. Or if you prefer public transportation, you can take a 7-minute walk to the CTA Blue Line Damen stop to take you downtown in 10 minutes or take you to O'Hare Airport, or you can take one of several different buses. Or walk 2-3 blocks to one of two different Divvy bike share stations.

In short, you'll be close to everything...without the noise!

Two other occupied apartments are in the building so please be mindful of quiet hours (10pm-8am weekdays, 11pm-9am weekends). If you know you'll be unable to respect the quiet hours, then this apartment is not for you.

The doorway to one of the lower level bedrooms is about 5' 9" but the bedroom itself as well as the rest of the lower level otherwise accommodates most people with good-sized ceiling height. 

The HDTV has local channels only. Wifi is high-speed internet with Xfinity.
house_rules:
When you book with us, you are agreeing to all of the following house rules:

1.  Please be respectful of upstairs neighbors.  Quiet hours are from 10pm-8am (weekdays) and 11pm-9am (weekends). Any noise complaints will result in a $50 charge.

2. If the apartment is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required.

3. There is absolutely NO SMOKING in the apartment.  Any smoking outside should be outside the black gates. Breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine.

4. Breaking anything in the apartment will mean that I will bill you for the damages.

5. Please put things back where they belong.  Clean up after yourself especially by putting garbage in garbage cans.

6. No glassware is allowed on the outside back deck.

7. Keep windows and exterior doors locked for safety.  Anyone that is reported by my tenants to have left any exterior doors open and/or unlocked will be given a warning and then a fine of $100, plus any other damages incurred as a result of theft.

8. Use the cover provided when using the microwave.

9. Lost key fee is $150 per key.  Lock out fee for exterior OR interior doors is $150 (that is if you leave your key in the unit and need to call me to let you back in). I do not have keys for interior doors that are locked.

10. At checkout, please hang all dirty towels on the over-the-door hooks in the bathrooms.

11. If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full.

12. If guests check out late, this delays the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time so guests will be charged $50. Guests who are still in the apartment after 12 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if we have approved a late checkout in advance.

13.  Please make sure to turn off the A/C or lower the heat setting to 60 degrees when you are leaving the unit (both to go out temporarily or for the final checkout) to help save energy and high utility bills.

14.  Please use coasters and placemats provided and wipe up spills promptly so as to not cause water marks and stains on wood tables.

Thank you for helping make your experience a great one!

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 
1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out/lost key penalty 
3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
6.) Please keep all entrance doors to the unit locked at all times.

description:
*SPECIAL* Dec-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Our three-bedroom Fulton House escape is ideal for traveling groups - four beds means it can comfortably sleep 8, and we're close to the Garfield Park Conservatory and the Green Line. We offer parking and it's a 20 minute train ride to the Loop and centrally located - ideal for any Chicago adventure you have in mind. Book today!

You enter our condo into an open living/dining space - which also includes an arcade version of Big Buck! Just off the dining area is a secluded office with a desk and shelving. Down the hallway are three bedrooms: two with queens, one with two queens, and a bathroom. At the rear of our condo is a large kitchen with a door to the back deck, shared backyard, and parking pad.

With streets that are decorated in vibrant murals and air that smells of carne guisada, Humboldt Park is a Caribbean escape shrouded in urban charm.

We're less than a 5 minute walk to the Kedzie green line station, and offer parking onsite.

description:
Private guest suite with separate entrance.  Sitting room, kitchenette, bedroom w/queen bed, private bath, plus twin sofa bed and/or air mattress in sitting room.  Great alternative to hotel for business trip or visiting the area. Conveniently located in southwest suburbs of Chicago, 40 minutes from downtown by car (non rush hour) or Metra lines a few miles from the house.  Set near a golf course and forest preserve, nearby to multiple restaurant and shopping districts less than 10 minutes away.

Furnished with decor, antique furniture and memorabilia from our families businesses in southern Ohio. Access to the suite is via a keypad on exterior door through a one car garage.

We live in the main part of the house, which is connected to the guest suite via a lockable door into our kitchen.

House is located in a single street development, backs up to a golf course and a 5 minute walk to the trail system in the expansive south suburban forest preserves.  Local restaurants and shops 5 minutes away, along with several developments with chain stores and restaurants less than 10 minutes drive.

Single car garage is available for guests upon request, good access to local highways (I-294, I-55, I-57, I-80) all less than 15 minutes.  Downtown Chicago can be reached in 40 minutes (non-rush hour) and multiple Metra commuter rails lines have stations within a 10 minute drive (or taxi ride).
house_rules: 11pm -7am quiet hours

transit: Single car garage is available for guests upon request, good access to local highways (I-294, I-55, I-57, I-80) all less than 15 minutes.  Downtown Chicago can be reached in 40 minutes (non-rush hour) and multiple Metra commuter rails lines have stations within a 10 minute drive (or taxi ride).
