access: - You will have access to the entire unit
description:
Welcome! Our modern, newly renovated bright and airy apartment will win you over. We are near the 606 elevated trail that will give you access to some of Logan Square's hottest restaurants, bars and attractions. Great for couples, families, a group of friends, solo or business. 

+ Walk Score 92 ("Walker's Paradise") 
+ Bike Score 87 ("Very Bikeable") 
+ FREE street parking
+ Friendly, responsive and helpful Superhosts

* 3 beds with room for a total of 6 people
* Private office with desk/chair
* Master bedroom with Queen bed
* 2nd bedroom with Queen bed
* Flat screen HDTV with Roku (access Netflix, Amazon with your account)
* Living room with comfy couch to enjoy during the day. 
* Dining space with seating for 6!
* Bathroom stocked with hair dryer, toiletries, and plenty of fresh towels
* Kitchen with Keurig coffee maker, serveware, new appliances 
* Iron & Board
* FREE street parking
* Washer/dryer available upon prior request (in basement)

- You will have access to the entire unit

We live in the condo above you but are generally out and about. That being said  consider us your concierge that's just a message away! We will be happy to provide restaurant and activity recommendations and answer any questions that come up during your stay.

Logan Square is HOT! Cutting edge restaurants, cafes, and breweries could keep you from ever wandering away. We're a 9 min walk from the new 606 Elevated Trail (think New York HighLine) which offers exhilarating walking, jogging or biking opportunities as you coast above the city. We're about a 5 min walk from Wyler Road, Damn Fine Coffee Shop & Rosa's Blues Lounge, a 10min walk from several other bars and restaurants including critically acclaimed Giant and  and a 20 min walk to the actual "square" in Logan Square including all the restaurants, cafes and shops.

*FREE Street Parking 
*25 min taxi to downtown. 
*20min walk to the heart of Logan Square including the Blue Line stop that takes you to Ohare airport or downtown.
*Divvy bike station 7min walk at Armitage & Spaulding
*2 bus lines nearby (Armitage & Fullerton) take you to Lincoln Park and Lakeview.

- We live in the unit above you but your space is a full private apartment.
- Free Street Parking (always check for temporary posted restrictions)

description:
We are an artist couple who are involved in political movement building. Basil is super into music of all varieties and I, Laura, love floral patterns and 1960s style decor. Our home is peppered with band flyers and posters, poetry, and vintage art. Our space isn't very large but it's clean and relaxing. We live in Rogers Park which is a family neighborhood that is inclusive to mostly middle class and lower middle class people of all racial, ethnic, and religious backgrounds.

There is a dog and cat that live in the home! Yep dog travels with us while Sage stays in the apartment. We rent our place at a cheaper rate and ask folks to fill her cat bowl and love on her.

We aren't in town when you stay here and that's the only times we rent our place out. We'll leave you keys so you can come and go as you please.

Rogers Park is Chicago's best kept secret. No other lakefront community in Chicago has as many beaches (10), not even the trendy neighborhoods of Edgewater or Lincoln Park immediately to its south. If you're a  lover the outdoors then you'll adore Rogers Park, with its extensive lakefront green space, unique street-end beaches, and incomparable morning sun rises over the lake there's nothing quite like it.

We are only a 5 minute walk from the Morse (redline) train stop which can get you to downtown Chicago in 40 minutes.

description:
Beautiful room located in a safe and upscale area. New bed, dresser, area for clothing, and lots of light. This wonderful Homestay is an easy walk to downtown Forest Park, Oak Park and River Forest. Located minutes from public transportation! Great space for anyone looking for a clean and comfortable environment. Close to Stroger, Rush, and Loyola! Easy 20 minute ride to downtown on the conveniently close Blue line or Green Line.

Spacious and clean homestay located in the heart of Oak Park we are an ideal spot for all of your travel and work needs! The room is fresh and spacious with clean new bedding and lots of storage.

Wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!

I am available for anything you may need!

The neighborhood is safe and one of a kind. You'll find many delicious restaurants, fun shops and plenty of unique things to check out! We have big city access with small town charm.

Close walk to all forms of public transportation (BLUE LINE - GREEN LINE - CTA BUS - PACE BUS) you'll find it effortless to get to your desired destination! Parking is also available nearby for an additional fee.

access: The entire place, except for the other two bedrooms (because they MAY be occupied with other Airbnb guests), is available for your stay. However, please sleep in your bedroom (and not in the common areas).
description:
Spacious and bright with soaring seven-foot windows, it is vintage Chicago architectural charm. The place is comfortable, tidy, and efficiently located on North Avenue in the heart of ultra-hip Wicker Park; Steps away from a thriving area full of popular restaurants, cafes, boutiques, concert venues, nightlife, etc.. There are convenient public transportation and Uber options to get all over the city, quickly and easily, from here also.

It is an expansive, high ceiling, three bedroom apartment, on the third floor of a building with a comedy bar below [Northbar  http://www.liveatnorthbar.com] - which often has hilarious performances. Everything you need for a comfortable stay is provided - full size beds, pillows, blankets, towels, toiletries, hair dryer, kitchen, washer & dryer, and tv & wifi are all accessible to enhance your stay.

The entire place, except for the other two bedrooms (because they MAY be occupied with other Airbnb guests), is available for your stay. However, please sleep in your bedroom (and not in the common areas).

I do not live at the apartment, yet I am nearby and available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, and also answer questions that you may have.

â€œWicker Park is famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries â€” many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour.

Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds.â€

https://www.choosechicago.com/neighborhoods/north/wicker-park-and-bucktown/

The apartment is located just 0.5 mile from the Blue Line Damen Station (connecting to Oâ€™Hare airport) which travels through much of the city. The North Avenue Bus Stop (72)  is just steps away from the building - running east and west. The Ashland Street Bus Stop (9) is steps away also - running north and south. Additionally, two blocks away is the Kennedy Expressway, North Avenue Exit. It is only three miles to downtown Chicago (7 minute Uber ride).

The place is NOT handicap accessible.
house_rules:
No shoes/boots
No lighting of candles
Please turn off the lights when leaving to conserve energy

additional_house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  
1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.

access: You'll have full access to my three-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment.
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

My 3 bedroom apartment in Sheridan Park is a stunning place to call home in Chicago - You'll love the neighborhood - its vibrant food and arts scene is uniquely diverse in Chicago. A mile north of Wrigley Field - Just to the east, Montrose Beach is a nice break from the city - if work is what brings to you to town, the nearby Brown line will take you right to the Loop. Book today!

My apartment is in a four-story elevator building, so no stairs! When you come into the apartment, the common space is open - kitchen, dining room, and living room - with bedrooms separate from one another. The bedroom with a King bed has an attached bathroom, while the second bathroom is accessible off the living room, across from the bedroom with a Queen-sized bed. The bedroom with a Full-sized bed closes with translucent sliding glass doors.

You'll have full access to my three-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment.

A vibrant blend of old and new, Sheridan Park is an intriguing neighborhood where Chicago's rich history and ethnic diversity intersect. This was a booming entertainment district for shopping and revelry in the 1920s and 1930s â€” though the area has witnessed multiple changes over time. Most recently, a renaissance has been underway in the Sheridan Park neighborhood and that formerly-faded glory is sparkling once again in the form of restored movie palaces and Art Deco beauties.

There's ample street parking in the neighborhood if you'll be driving, but my apartment is also a 10-minute or so walk to the Montrose Brown line station, and just steps to the Clark Street bus, which will bring to the Addison Red line train station. The neighborhood itself is very walkable, as well!

description:
Over 2,000 sq ft, this basement has 10 ft ceilings, full kitchen, bath, and makes you feel at home. With a 65â€ inch smart tv, washer/dryer, and internet, you have everything you need.
Owners reside upstairs, but are very quiet and accommodating. Come stay in one of the best and convenient areas in Chicago. This home on on a dead end street is only 2 blocks to the brown line train which goes downtown (about 40 min ride). Restaurants and shopping at lincoln square is 15 min walk.

The backyard is available to our guests.

We are very accommodating to our guests. We are available by text.

Ravenswood Manor has no shortage of incredible cuisine nearby. Walking down a city block, you could pass a kabob restaurant, Korean barbecue, gourmet South American fare, and a number of family-owned sweets shops.

The brown line train is only 2 blocks away, and the CTA (bus)is just behind the house on the main street.

Part of this neighborhoodâ€™s draw is its tranquil ambiance, so you wonâ€™t find much of a nightlife in the neighborhood. Luckily, thereâ€™s plenty of fun to be had at the bars and restaurants nearby in Lincoln Square. You might also check out some live music at the Old Town School of Folk Music in Ravenswood
house_rules:
Guest needs to clean after themselves. 
Please take off shoes. 
Please make sure fireplace and electricity is off when you go out.
Please make sure the fireplace is off when you go to bed.
Please make sure the door is locked when you leave or come in.
Please put bed sheets and towels in washer on your last day.

additional_house_rules: Rental Agreement- Once booked you agree to all terms.  House Rules- These rules are simple to follow but if you cannot follow them please do not book.   â€¢	Respect the neighbors/ neighborhood and keep the noise to a minimum.   â€¢	No Parties or get- togethers of any kind are allowed â€¢	Please keep the noise to a minimum after 10pm â€¢	Take your shoes off at the door â€¢	Treat my place as though it was your own home.   Damage Deposit and Fines:  â—	If any sort of party is thrown, you will not get your damage deposit and/ or will be fined $100- $500  â—	If there are found to be more people staying at the property than the number of guests stated in the reservation you will be fined $25 per person per night.  If the number exceeds 8 people you will not get any of your deposit back or you will be fined an additional $100. â—	Failure to return the keys will result in a $35 fine  â—	If anything is stolen or missing, you will be fined, or your damage deposit will be docked accordingly.  â—	Anything else deemed inappropriate could also result in a partial or total loss of your damage deposit or a $100 fine.  â—	Guests are not permitted past 10 p.m.  That does not mean you can throw a party until 10 p.m.  Parties are never permitted.  However, I understand people have friends or family in town and they might stop by for a bit and that is ok as long they also observe the rules. â—	The reason these rules are in place is to ensure the property, the neighbors and the neighborhood are respected.  If all three of those things happen there shouldn't be any issues.    Prior to Booking:  Required:  â€¢	Your email and phone number must be verified  Encouraged: â€¢	Additional verifications including verifying your Facebook account and Government ID  â€¢	Uploading a clear image of yourself   After Booking:   â€¢	After booking and before your stay I require that you send me a picture of your government issued ID.  (This is no different than a hotel looking at your ID upon arrival.)  Upon receipt of your ID I will send you the necessary access instructions for the unit.  You will receive the instructions either 1 week before your stay or immediately if your stay is less than a week away.  â€¢	In some cases, depending on the circumstances, I may call you as one final screening.  In the event that I do choose to reach out to you, access instructions will not be released until we speak.  If I do not hear back from you 24- 48 hours I may ask you to cancel your reservation.      Check Out:  â€¢	Check out is at 10am on the last day of your stay.  This check out time applies to all stays unless an alternate plan has been discussed and payment for late check out or extending your stay has been made.  If you fail to check out at 10 am, or fail to make the necessary payment extending your stay before 10am on the last day of your stay, then we hold the right to fine you $50 for every hour you stay beyond your designated check out time.

description:
Nestled in the vibrant neighborhood of Avondale, this 3 bedroom apartment is just off the bustling strip of Milwaukee Avenue. Enjoy famed local eateries from Chicago's own top chefs all within a 5 minute drive or hop on the 'L' for a quick commute to downtown Chicago!
The apartment offers 3 queen-sized beds, 1 bathroom, and a convertible sofa in the living room for extra sleeping space. There is wifi, laundry on-site, as well as available parking space.

There are a total of 3 bedrooms, each equipped with a queen-sized bed. The living room sofa can also be converted for extra sleeping space for 2. We provide all bedding needs (bed sheets, pillows and pillow cases) and basic toiletries (toilet paper, shampoo, and bath soap as well as bath and hand towels).Â 
Wi-Fi is available complete with Netflix and streaming service. There is a washer and dryer unit on-site as well and parking is available just behind the building.

The apartment straddles the border between the up-and-coming neighborhood of Avondale and the hip quarter of Logan Square. The area is home to some of the best restaurants in Chicago including Parachute, Fat Rice, Longman and Eagle and Mott St. The espresso game is also not to be missed with local favorites such as Intelligentsia, Collectivo and Buzz Roasters pulling excellent shots.

The Blue Line is just a 15-minute walk from the apartment and the bus routes are just around the corner. Both of which can take you directly to downtown or the industrial food haven of West Loop.

description:
Comfortable and clean room in a spacious house in Logan Square, one of Chicago's hottest neighborhoods. Just steps from a Blue Line train station that runs 24/7 direct to O'Hare Intl. Airport (ORD). Easy and FREE street parking! Convienient self check-in with lockbox. I invite you to make yourself at home and enjoy the use of common spaces, kitchen, laundry and beautiful backyard.

I encourage guests to enjoy the space and feel free to do laundry, cook a great meal, hang out in the backyard and grill..

â˜…Plenty of FREE and easy parking
â˜…5 minute walk to Blue Line train at California and Milwaukee 
â˜…California/Cortland bus stop at immediate corner

access: The guests have access to all area except the master suite and basement.
description:
Beautiful  row house in the historic Bronzeville community. The home sits next door to the famous Louis Armstrong house.  Features a full kitchen, dining area, 1  1/2 baths,living and family rooms. The outdoor deck is  furnished and has a grill. This quiet community is  steps from public bus /train transportation and a short drive to 90/94 and Lakeshore Drive expressways.  Close proximity to shopping, entertainment, parks restaurants,  museum campus,lakefront, beaches, downtown Chicago.

The guests have access to all area except the master suite and basement.

Send a message on the message board or text me.

The community has a variety of businesses. Everything you need is within the area. Travel is convenient because the community is close to public transportation and expressways.

For travel in Google CTA travel information  or goroo.com.

additional_house_rules:
General Rules
-Please treat the home as if it is your own.
-Please respect our guest limit capacity of 8 people.
-Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property.
-If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest.
-We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out.
-Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing.

Quiet Hours
Quiet hours are between 10p-8a.
This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.

Please be advised that this home is equipped with NoiseAware. NoiseAware works like a smoke detector, but for noise. The sensor tracks the decibel levels in this home, evaluates other risk factors and will send an alert if there are excess noise levels detected. Please do not unplug the device.

Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine. 

No Smoking
The home (and entire building including outdoor common areas) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in the building. Please respect our policy and step outside the vicinity.

Key Fob
The key fob is your way of accessing everything from your short-stay apartment to the amenity spaces in the building. If you happen to lose your key fob, you will be charged $75. 

Security
Please be advised that the building exterior and common spaces are equipped with surveillance devices. Please respect the building and its community. 

Emergencies
Contact your host immediately with any issues. An emergency maintenance number is provided in the home guide for any building issues that involve water or hazards in the home.

For medical, fire and police related emergencies please call 911.

access: The entire home as well as all building amenities are for you to enjoy!
description:
Welcome to SCOTS THISTLE ! All the amenities of a luxury hotel with as much space as a single-family home! Enjoy this unique newly constructed duplex 3 bed unit featuring a private terrace, in-unit washer/dryer, and open floor plan living space . Whether it's for business or pleasure, this home is your perfect home away from home. Hang at the coffee shop, bike rental, fitness facility, pool tables, a stylish rooftop deck lounge complete with fire pits, grills, and breath taking city views.

Sleeping Arrangements 
Master Bedroom - Queen Bed 
Bedroom 2 - Queen Bed 
Bedroom 3 - Queen Bed 
Living Room - pull out sleeper sofa (queen) + 2 cots (twin)*
*Please not that cots are available upon request only and need to be requested at the time of booking. We cannot accommodate last minute requests. 

Kitchen  
The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar â€“ for however you take it.  
 
Cleaning Supplies  
Youâ€™re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels.

Washer/Dryer 
There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay!

TV
The Roku guide is posted next to the TV. There is also a digital antenna for local channels. Please remember to sign out of any of any Roku apps youâ€™ve utilize duringâ€¨your stay. 

Non-Smoking 
The home and entire building is designated as a smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in unit or the building. Please respect our policy and step outside.

Deck 
Bring culinary inspiration to life on your private deck with outdoor grilling station!

Gym
The fitness center is equipped with free weights, strength training and cardio machines, you donâ€™t have to skip leg day on your vacation (if you donâ€™t want to).

Parking
There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.

The entire home as well as all building amenities are for you to enjoy!

We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing reservations@livly.io!  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.

The perfect location for a weekend getaway or business trip. River North is a stylish urban neighborhood that borders the Magnificent Mile and is just across the bridge from the Loop, Millennium Park, and the downtown theater district. It is the go-to neighborhood for those who appreciate fine art and design, but is also a little quieter than being right in the middle of downtown. For those who appreciate fine dining and drinks, you can find everything from knockout noodles and Spanish small plates to high-end steakhouses and famed pizzerias. Just about every type of cuisine is covered in this mix of award-winning restaurants and local favorites. And for a fun evening out, slip into any of the sleek new clubs, upscale wine bars and craft cocktail lounges, many of which are walking distance from the home.

There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby. 

The home is a short walk from the CTA brown line train at the "Chicago" stop. This train line will take you all over the city, including into the neighborhoods further north and south for exploring or down into the loop to catch a show or transfer to another train line.

Check In / Check Out
Check in starts at 4 PM CT
Check out time is 11 AM CT

We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out. 

Luggage Hold 
If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city.

Pets
There is a $25/pet per booking fee. 

We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them: Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wolf Hybrids.

While we trust that your pet plays well with others, we know that accidents happen. In the event of an issue involving your pet, you will be required to provide up to date vaccination records and will be fully liable for any medical, veterinary, or property damages incurred.

Please maintain our home and our supplies and cookware properly by cleaning up after yourself. During the summer months we ask that you turn the air-conditioning off when you leave the building unless thereâ€™s an animal in the house. In which case we would ask that you turn off the AC units in the other rooms - so we do not waste energy needlessly. On humid days it is nice to turn the AC down to 80Â° to keep the humidity out - When you have left the building.  when you return home return change to 68Â° which only takes a few minutes.  
This is your structure completely -no one will be entering the structure.  you are responsible for cleaning and maintaining the house.

access: Wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!
description:
This wonderful Home is an easy walk to downtown Forest Park, Oak Park and River Forest. Located minutes from public transportation! Great space for anyone looking for a clean and comfortable environment. Close to Stroger, Rush, and Loyola! Easy 20 minute ride to downtown on the conveniently close Blue line or Green Line. Walk to the blue line Forest Park station in seven minutes. One block north of downtown Forest Park. A 12 minute walk to downtown Oak Park and River Forest

Spacious and clean home located in the heart of Forest Park we are an ideal spot for all of your travel and work needs! fresh and spacious with clean new bedding

Wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!

I am available for anything you may need!

The neighborhood is safe and one of a kind. You'll find many delicious restaurants, fun shops and plenty of unique things to check out! We have big city access with small town charm.

Close walk to all forms of public transportation (BLUE LINE - GREEN LINE - CTA BUS - PACE BUS) you'll find it effortless to get to your desired destination! Parking is also available nearby for an additional fee.

Laundry facilities are available across the courtyard in the other building -just a few feet away.  Laundry is Coin operated. You will need to provide your own soap and laundry materials. A laundry basket is provided.  Quite  hours from 8pm to 8 am.
Must clean up after yourself when using bath, kitchen and common areas.  Light easy simple cooking only.  No big meals.
Toaster oven is provided- the large oven is not operable.
Common areas in kitchens are closed at 9:30 PM with the exception of quiet microwave toaster oven and hot pot
house_rules:
Please maintain our home and our supplies and cookware properly by cleaning up after yourself. During the summer months we ask that you turn the air-conditioning off when you leave the building unless thereâ€™s an animal in the house. In which case we would ask that you turn off the AC units in the other rooms - so we do not waste energy needlessly. On humid days it is nice to turn the AC down to 80Â° to keep the humidity out - When you have left the building.  when you return home return change to 68Â° which only takes a few minutes.  
This is your structure completely -no one will be entering the structure.  you are responsible for cleaning and maintaining the house.

Short walk to shopping complex. Lots of cafÃ©s and restaurants in walking distance.

Large deck, quiet neighborhood.

description:
* Also See NOTES in "The Space" *
Lovely single family house with large fenced yard. One large bedrm with a good-size closet. Common areas include living, dining, kitchen & laundry rooms. Great for business travelers with office amenities (printer, copier), iron & washer&dryer. 

Quiet & upscale suburbs.  Known for its Frank L Wright hses. Cls to public trans & I-290. 15 min to dwntwn Chicago via train & 20 min by car (normal traffic). Near Loyola Med Ctr & Hines VA & Rush Hsptl

NOTES: 
(1) REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY (see below)
(2) The host typically would like to greet the guests in person, occasionally this may not be possible.  In the latter case, please contact the host for the procedure of "Self Check-in". 
(3) Let the host know if you plan to drive so the parking matter can be addressed if needed.

REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY
Guests choose a place to stay based what it serves them the best.  We would like to highlight a few items worth considering and invite you to book this place.
(a) We run a very efficient operation and have a very competitive room rate with high quality rooms and services;
(b) This house has an exceptional great location.  It is about 10 minutes to a Green Line Station by walking (hence very close to downtown Chicago) and has convenient access to west, north west, and south west of greater Chicagoland by car.
(c) Free parking is provided.  Parking can be very very expensive in any larger metropolitan, including downtown Chicago.  Therefore it is much more economical to park here and take the train to downtown Chicago. If you rent a room in or near downtown Chicago, you implicitly or explicitly spend a lot of money just on parking.
(d) The "Occupancy Tax" is about 11% here which is much less than 23% or higher (doubled) in Chicago. The occupancy tax is paid by the guests based on the sum of room rate and cleaning fee.  With this tax and parking cost in mind, it is much more economical (and without losing convenient access to downtown Chicago) to stay in a convenient suburbs rather than in Chicago or downtown Chicago. Since the "Occupancy Tax" is waived if you stay 31 days or longer, you can avoid this tax and save quite a bit of money if you plan your trip ahead and check with the host for room availability.

====== Other Information  ========
Cereal, waffles and coffee are provided by the host for the ARRIVAL day/night of the guests. A full service restaurant (Blue Max Cafe) is only a block north of the house (serves breakfast and lunch only). Various fast food and slow food restaurants are also very close.  A great oriental message service is just couple blocks south of the house (not too expensive, please get coupon from the host for one-time discount).

The house is the middle of Oak Park and Forest Park downtown (almost equal distance).  You have access to 24 hours super markets, and all sorts of other stores and entertainment in both downtown, plus big Chicago downtown of course. Come to stay in the house, and enjoy both the big Chicago, and friendly cute downtown in both Oak Park and Forest Park.
space:
NOTES: 
(1) REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY (see below)
(2) The host typically would like to greet the guests in person, occasionally this may not be possible.  In the latter case, please contact the host for the procedure of "Self Check-in". 
(3) Let the host know if you plan to drive so the parking matter can be addressed if needed.

REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY
Guests choose a place to stay based what it serves them the best.  We would like to highlight a few items worth considering and invite you to book this place.
(a) We run a very efficient operation and have a very competitive room rate with high quality rooms and services;
(b) This house has an exceptional great location.  It is about 10 minutes to a Green Line Station by walking (hence very close to downtown Chicago) and has convenient access to west, north west, and south west of greater Chicagoland by car.
(c) Free parking is provided.  Parking can be very very expensive in any larger metropolitan, including downtown Chicago.  Therefore it is much more economical to park here and take the train to downtown Chicago. If you rent a room in or near downtown Chicago, you implicitly or explicitly spend a lot of money just on parking.
(d) The "Occupancy Tax" is about 11% here which is much less than 23% or higher (doubled) in Chicago. The occupancy tax is paid by the guests based on the sum of room rate and cleaning fee.  With this tax and parking cost in mind, it is much more economical (and without losing convenient access to downtown Chicago) to stay in a convenient suburbs rather than in Chicago or downtown Chicago. Since the "Occupancy Tax" is waived if you stay 31 days or longer, you can avoid this tax and save quite a bit of money if you plan your trip ahead and check with the host for room availability.

====== Other Information  ========
Cereal, waffles and coffee are provided by the host for the ARRIVAL day/night of the guests. A full service restaurant (Blue Max Cafe) is only a block north of the house (serves breakfast and lunch only). Various fast food and slow food restaurants are also very close.  A great oriental message service is just couple blocks south of the house (not too expensive, please get coupon from the host for one-time discount).

The house is the middle of Oak Park and Forest Park downtown (almost equal distance).  You have access to 24 hours super markets, and all sorts of other stores and entertainment in both downtown, plus big Chicago downtown of course. Come to stay in the house, and enjoy both the big Chicago, and friendly cute downtown in both Oak Park and Forest Park.
summary:
* Also See NOTES in "The Space" *
Lovely single family house with large fenced yard. One large bedrm with a good-size closet. Common areas include living, dining, kitchen & laundry rooms. Great for business travelers with office amenities (printer, copier), iron & washer&dryer. 

Quiet & upscale suburbs.  Known for its Frank L Wright hses. Cls to public trans & I-290. 15 min to dwntwn Chicago via train & 20 min by car (normal traffic). Near Loyola Med Ctr & Hines VA & Rush Hsptl

access: You'll have full access to the entire loft, and several shared bathrooms - cleaned daily - just down the hall, plus the building's laundry room.
description:
A renovated and professionally decorated loft in a building dating to the 1880s in Old Town is exactly where you want to stay during your trip to Chicago - the location is ideal for seeing everything you've got on your list: across the street from Second City, Steppenwolf, and Lincoln Park, and about 20 minutes' train ride from the Loop or Wrigley Field. Book today!

This unit doesn't have its own bathroom, and instead shares access to several bathrooms - cleaned daily - conveniently located near the unit. One of the beds in my place is up a narrow set of stairs / step ladder.

You'll have full access to the entire loft, and several shared bathrooms - cleaned daily - just down the hall, plus the building's laundry room.

An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

My place is a few minutes' walk away from the Sedgwick Brown/Purple line train station, and equally convenient to the North Ave and LaSalle buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, there are several garages nearby with overnight parking.

This loft has access to several shared bathrooms - cleaned daily - just down the hall. The large windows in this unit face a busy street, so you're likely to hear city noise.

3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.

access: You will have complete and private access to our condo.
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Our two-bedroom condo is beautifully appointed and has vintage charm everywhere you look. You'll have access to a shared backyard, and all of the amenities of home - while being a 10 minute walk from some of the hottest bars and restaurants in Chicago. Book today!

You enter our condo into a dining room that's open to a living room, with high ceilings and plenty of windows. Off the living room is a semi-separated nook with another couch. To the left of the entrance is a bedroom with a queen bed, and beyond that, a bathroom, and large eat-in kitchen. Off the kitchen is another queen bed. You'll also have access to an enclosed porch and shared backyard.

You will have complete and private access to our condo.

In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.

We're a 10 minute walk to the CTA blue line, and near several north-south and east-west buses - you won't have any trouble getting around town without a car while staying here!

access: Guests may access the living and dining rooms and kitchen.
description:
South-facing, large master bedroom (16' X 14') with bath en-suite & secluded balcony is just inside the front door for easy access/egress. Enjoy lovely natural light and in the summer, a screen of honey locust trees. Minutes from Lake Michigan, Hyde Park restaurants, UChicago, museums, major highways & express public transit to downtown.

We welcome guests and look forward to meeting you. We have two sweet, friendly dogs and two lovely, if aloof, cats. Please join us!

Large south-facing master suite, overlooking a row of honey locusts, has a walk-in shower and its own balcony. The suite is just inside the front door of this lovely condo, providing easy and private access and egress. We offer wifi, HDTV with cable (HBO, Showtime, etc.), a desk, 2 bed trays, ironing board & iron, hair dryer and continental breakfast.

Guests may access the living and dining rooms and kitchen.

Experience Kenwood, one of the City's loveliest neighborhoods with tree-lined streets and beautiful single family homes. We are very close to Lake Michigan and the City's museums. The University of Chicago is nearby as are restaurants and shops.

Walk two blocks to the stop for express buses that carry passengers to Chicago's downtown or three blocks to an electric train that speeds it way to the Chicago Loop. Density in Kenwood is low, therefore, street parking is plentiful.
house_rules: If you order out or bring in food, please eat at either the dining room, kitchen table or weather permitting, balcony. Sorry, there are no cooking privileges other than making tea or coffee in the morning and enjoying toast, English muffin or banana bread, when I've made it, for breakfast. You always may help yourself to water and ice from the refrigerator door. Unless it is unpleasant in some way, we prefer that shoes are parked at the front door and not worn in the condo.

access: Guests can access the garden area and a front and back porch to sit outside. They have private entrances that will not disturb us or other guests. Amenities include kitchen equipped with appliances, microwave and Keurig coffee station.
description:
Royal Coach House Cottage-

Nestled in Bronzeville community and nearby Historic Hyde Park neighborhood that is safe and family oriented. Our space is quite cozy, quaint and ideal for relaxation, peace & quiet. Flower and vegetation garden landscape.  

Centrally located 1.5 miles from lake front, nearby shopping, movie theater, and restaurants. Seconds from park, walking track and playground. Minutes from downtown and Magnificent Mile. Local transportation accessible including bicycle rental.

The unit is located on the 1st floor with its own private entrance. There is a front porch to sit out and enjoy the scenery and back porch with access to grill. Free off street parking and plentiful street parking.  There is an alarm system for added security and easy check-in with key code entry system. The code is changed after each guest.

Guests can access the garden area and a front and back porch to sit outside. They have private entrances that will not disturb us or other guests. Amenities include kitchen equipped with appliances, microwave and Keurig coffee station.

We welcome interaction with guests. We come and go, however, if we see the guests outside, we love to meet and talk with them.

The neighborhood is quiet and clean. The neighbors are nice and respectful of each other.

There is public transportation which includes buses (3 block walk) and trains (4 block walk) that can get you downtown in 25 mins and 15 mins, respectively.

description:
Perfect luxury Old Town condo with amazing outdoor space! Private Bedroom and Bathroom, living area, electric fireplace, TV (Netflix/HBO/Hulu) and washer/dryer. Two large patios and skyline views.  Walk to New City, Wells Street, Clybourn Shops, Lincoln Park Shopping, Red, Purple & Brown Lines and all Chicago has to offer!  

Our home is perfect for quiet couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

Luxuriously decorated home in the best neighborhood in Chicago - Old Town.  This home provides an urban oasis with easy access to it all - walking distance to Wells Street or New City dining/nightlife, steps to Second City, North Avenue Beach, and easy access to public transportation.   When you return to the unit, relax in the comfort and coziness of brand new furniture, Simmons Beautyrest mattress and a fully private bathroom.

- No smoking allowed (inside or out). 
- No shoes in the house. 
- Guests have access to kitchen for coffee/tea/light meal prep and living area.
- Guests cannot use the Master Bedroom, Office, Dining Room or Front Room. 
- Guests cannot use the bar or food unless offered by the host.
- No sleeping on the couches. 
- No parties allowed in the house.
- No visitors allowed.
- Access to the house is provided electronically via cell phone.

An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its close proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

Uber is extremely efficient, but the CTA Red, Purple & Brown 'L' Train or numerous CTA Bus Stops are a 5-minute walk.

Street Parking is Permit Only.  Permits can be provided at no charge.  Covered garage parking available for $10 per night.

Unit is located on the 3rd Floor (essentially 2nd, as the 1st Floor are garden units). There is no elevator, so it may not be suitable for people who cannot climb stairs.  Non-ADA Accessible. Our family also includes a very friendly and hypoallergenic dog.

Cancellation Policy:  Flexible per Airbnb's policies.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). Youâ€™ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, weâ€™ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so youâ€™ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, weâ€™ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- Fully-equipped kitchen 

Building amenities
- Laundry facilities

South Loop highlights
- Walkability score: 95
- 4 minute walk to Yolk (our favorite brunch spot)
- 4 minute walk to Flo & Santos (delicious pizzeria and pub)

Getting around
- 1 minute walk to Roosevelt Station 
- 5 minute drive to downtown
- 30 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 54 minute drive to ORD Airport

The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

This is a central location and prone to noise.

access: Guests have full use of entire space and amenities. In lieu of broadcast television TV includes Netflix, Hulu, HBO Now and Apple TV.
description:
Trendy midcentury space in hip Logan Square. Just steps away from the hottest neighborhood in Chicago. Hot restaurants, shops and bars just a block away.

3rd floor walk up in vintage building with radiator heat.

Guests have full use of entire space and amenities. In lieu of broadcast television TV includes Netflix, Hulu, HBO Now and Apple TV.

We're always available 24/7 365.

Logan Square is one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago. It has some of the most dynamic restaurants, shops and bars in all of Chicago.

Two blocks from the Logan Square blue line stop. Divvy bike rental one block away.

Vintage walk up building. Unit located on the third floor. Sorry no elevator. Unit has radiator heat and window box AC.
house_rules:
Please do not eat in the bedroom

Please do not leave food out that will attract pests

Please do not cook, bring foods/items that leave a lingering scent

Please wash and put away used items in the kitchen

Out of resect for the neighbors we ask that there is never loud music, television, media, voices, etc.

Neighbor relations are critical. It is our expectation that all guests will treat the neighbors with respect and courtesy at all times

Please use coasters when placing drinks on woodwork

During winter please remove shoes/boots at unit front door, boot tray provided

Please close all windows before leaving and lock door on your way out. 

No parties, extra guests and no illegal drugs. Authorities will be contacted.
interaction: We're always available 24/7 365.

access: Laundry Room
description:
This is an amazing garden level apartment right off Clark st. with all the shops and restaurants right down the block.  Grab a coffee at the Coffee Studio or a drink at Little Bad Wolf or Stone Fox.  This unit has a brand new kitchen and has a Smart TV with Netflix and YouTube etc a huge living room to hang out, and new bathroom with a large shower.

Everything is brand new in the space.  Its lovely in summer time nice and cool. 
The entry way to the apartment is on the left hand side of house (when facing it).   There is a light that is always on.

Laundry Room

We are available for questions through the Airbnb app at any time.

Andersonville is a wonderful neighborhood on the north side of Chicago.  There are loads of places to eat, drink and dance!  There is a great little gift shop at Gethsemane around the corner and Stone Fox on the corner for that delicious evening cocktail.

Walk to all the shops. There is free street parking in front of our house on the street. We are 10 minutes to the Red Line Bryn Mawr station and steps to the Clark st bus.

You can park for free in front of the house.

No drugs ever

description:
Located in Ukranian Village, the new "hot" neighborhood,  it's close to many great eateries and pubs.  
 A beautiful yard filled with flowers and plants and a large deck in back with a canopy to sit outside and unwind at the end of the day.  
Inside is very comfy.  A combination of vintage and modern.
The guest room has a queen size mattress and curtains heavy enough to block out the street lights.
Its one short block from Chicago Avenue and the #66 bus that goes down town.

additional_house_rules:
***This is a SHARED ROOM and roommates are to be expected. The room is not Gender Exclusive, you roommate(s) could be Male or Female. We kindly ask you to pack as lightly as possible as space will be limited***

***Surveillance cameras are present at each entrance to the home, in the kitchen, living room, and stairwell. All cameras are on at all times.*** 

Check-In Rules:
Unfortunately, I will not always be able to personally meet all guests at their desired check in time.

If I'm unable to meet you, I'll provide the Digital Door Lock Code with very detailed instructions for entry which will be messaged through Airbnb messenger at your Check-In time. You'll be given instant access to the building whenever you arrive! Please TAKE YOUR SHOES OFF upon entering the home. 

Food and Beverages:
There is absolutely NO consumption of food or beverages (excluding water) outside of the kitchen, kitchen bar, and dining room.

All food and beverages in the fridge and kitchen cabinets belong to other guests and your host. Refrain from taking food/beverages that were not brought in or purchased by you. Coffee, creamer, and sugar on the coffee bar in the kitchen are complimentary and you may have as much of it as you'd like. 

Guest Policy:
"Guest" constitutes any person entering the property, whether spending the night or only visiting. Unverified, unauthorized guests are not allowed on the premises. If you'd like to have a guest during your stay, your guest MUST be verified and announced through the AirBnb messenger and approval of this guest must be explicitly given by us, the hosts. Violation of this rule will result in immediate cancellation of your reservation and termination of your stay. 

Mail:
Please notify the host if you want to have Mail/Parcels shipped to you during your stay.

Quiet Hours:
Quiet Hours at the residence are between the hours of 10pm and 7am Sunday-Thursday and 12am and 7am on Friday-Saturday.

This is a Shared Space with many Travelers all visiting Chicago for a different purpose.  Having common courtesy is more than enough to fulfill this rule.  If you're a Late Night personality, please respect those waking up early for work.  If you're up at the crack of dawn, please get ready as quietly as possible as to not disturb those still asleep.

Smoking:
There is absolutely no smoking inside of the building.  This includes Electronic Cigarettes and all other forms of Tobacco.

Travelers are more than welcome to Smoke outside of the building.  


Weapons:
Absolutely NO WEAPONS of any sort are allowed inside of the building.  This includes Firearms, Knives, and anything else that can be used in a malicious manner.  Host(s) will have Final Say in what constitutes as a weapon.

Violence:
There will be no violence of any sort tolerated inside of the building.  This includes Physical Violence, Verbal (Arguing, Threats, Intimidation, etc.), and any sort of behavior that causes another person in the house to feel upset. 

â€˜Common Senseâ€™ Rule:
As this is a Shared Building, guests are expected to act in a way which is both Respectful and Inviting to everyone else sharing the space.   Actions which are deemed to have a Negative Impact on the overall experience of the other travelers will not be tolerated.  A few examples of this would be:  Leaving Dishes unwashed in the sink, being excessively messy or loud, or just having a negative, unwelcoming attitude.  If Behavior is causing other Travelers to feel uncomfortable, we will ask you to make necessary corrections, if these corrections are not made, we will terminate your stay.

Illegal Activity:
Any action which is in violation of any law within the city of Chicago and the state of Illinois is grounds for instant Termination


Check-Out Rules:
Check out is at 10AM, which is when the cleaning crew arrives. 
All guests that FAIL to vacate the premises prior to the 10AM check out will be charged $50 - No Exceptions!

description:
*** SHARED ROOM ***

Located near I-290 and the Blue Line this shared room is perfect for any Tourist or Business Traveler looking to explore Chicago.
		
Queen Bed (2 Guests)
65" Smart TV in Common Area
Fireplace 
Wi-Fi / Cable TV / Netflix 
Complimentary Coffee Bar
New, stainless steel appliances: Stove, Fridge, Microwave
2 Bathrooms stocked with Essentials
Minutes away from Popular Tourist Areas, CTA Public Transit, and various local attractions

Located near I-290 and the Blue Line this shared room is perfect for any Tourist or Business Traveler looking to explore Chicago.
	
Queen Bed (2 Guests)
65" Smart TV in Common Area
Fireplace 
Wi-Fi / Cable TV / Netflix 
Complimentary Coffee Bar
New, stainless steel appliances: Stove, Fridge, Microwave
2 Bathrooms stocked with Essentials
Minutes away from Popular Tourist Areas, CTA Public Transit, and various local attractions
Room Specifications:
- Comfortable Queen Mattress (Hampton & Rhodes HR 200)
- Closet Space to hang your Wardrobe
- Lighting Fast Wi-Fi Internet 
	
Bathroom:
- 2 Shared Washrooms for all Travelers 
- Essentials Provided:
   - Toilet Paper 
   - Shampoo / Conditioner 
   - Soap / Body Wash 
   - Towels 
   - Hair Dryer 
   - Iron 
   - Ironing Board

Office:
This House contains a few shared â€œStudy Areasâ€ perfect for any Business Traveler, Student, or Tourist on the go!  
Comfortable living room and dining room areas and lightning fast Wi-Fi provide the perfect oasis to stay on top of your busy life!

Living/Dining Area:
The â€˜Family Roomâ€™ contains a comfortable sofa and love-seat, a 65â€ Flat Screen Television, and a fireplace to share a few laughs with your fellow travelers!   

Kitchen:
New, stainless steel appliances (Stove, Microwave, Refrigerator) and cooking utensils will enable you to enjoy the luxuries of home while you're on the road!
A Coffee / Tea Kiosk will enable you to have your morning beverage of choice hot and ready to go for you each and every morning!
Dining Room Table with modern decor overlooking the fireplace and TV so you can always stay connected!

Laundry:
***Only available for reservations longer than one week***
Fully-Functional Washer & Dryer are located in the Basement. Laundry facilities are available only upon request and while a staff member and/or host are present.   
Laundry Detergent & Fabric Softener are not provided. 

Parking:
Parking on the street, directly in front of the house, is unfortunately not permitted. If you are bringing a vehicle, please ensure you are legally parked. 

Locks:
The Listing has a Digital Door Lock. The Door Code will be provided at 3PM on your Check-In date.

You and your guests will have access to the following areas:
	
- Bedroom 
- Bathrooms - Shared with all Travelers
- Kitchen / Dining Room Area - Shared with all Travelers
- Living Room Area (Couches & TV) - Shared with all Travelers

I love to meet new people, but due to the nature of my schedule, our interactions could be minimal. 

I will, however, be on location in the event that you need anything during your stay, and I am always a Text, Phone Call, or AirBnb Message away to ensure that all of my Guests have an Amazing, 5-Star Experience!

Chicago Blue Line:
	
Located right on I-290 & only a mile away from Chicago's 'Blue Line', this location is perfect for anyone looking to take in the Sights of Chicago!  

Whether you're going Downtown to check out Navy Pier & Millennium Park, enjoy a Concert or Game at the United Center, or head to O'Hare International Airport to continue your journey; you'll always be just a few minutes away!

If you choose to spend an Evening around the House, you'll enjoy a diverse neighborhood with various options in terms of Shops & Dining.

Distance To Nearest Public Transit:

Bus: 0.3 mi (3 Blocks)
Train: 1 mi (Blue Line: Forest Park)

Want to know how far your Destination is from my Place?  Enter Harrison St. & 17th Ave. into Goo.gle Maps, then type in your Destination.  You'll see pretty accurate Travel Times whether you're driving, taking the bus, using the CTA system, or walking.  This will also take into account real-time traffic to give you an even more accurate estimate!

Travel Distance to Chicago Landmarks:
- MDW International Airport = 12 mi.
- ORD International Airport = 10 mi. 
- Union Station = 12 mi.  
- United Center = 10 mi.
- U.S. Cellular Field = 14 mi.
- Wrigley Field = 19 mi.
- Soldier Field = 15 mi.

In the event you need to access and use the Laundry Facility, please contact the host.
house_rules:
***This is a SHARED ROOM and roommates are to be expected. The room is not Gender Exclusive, you roommate(s) could be Male or Female. We kindly ask you to pack as lightly as possible as space will be limited***

***Surveillance cameras are present at each entrance to the home, in the kitchen, living room, and stairwell. All cameras are on at all times.*** 

Check-In Rules:
Unfortunately, I will not always be able to personally meet all guests at their desired check in time.

If I'm unable to meet you, I'll provide the Digital Door Lock Code with very detailed instructions for entry which will be messaged through Airbnb messenger at your Check-In time. You'll be given instant access to the building whenever you arrive! Please TAKE YOUR SHOES OFF upon entering the home. 

Food and Beverages:
There is absolutely NO consumption of food or beverages (excluding water) outside of the kitchen, kitchen bar, and dining room.

All food and beverages in the fridge and kitchen cabinets belong to other guests and your host. Refrain from taking food/beverages that were not brought in or purchased by you. Coffee, creamer, and sugar on the coffee bar in the kitchen are complimentary and you may have as much of it as you'd like. 

Guest Policy:
"Guest" constitutes any person entering the property, whether spending the night or only visiting. Unverified, unauthorized guests are not allowed on the premises. If you'd like to have a guest during your stay, your guest MUST be verified and announced through the AirBnb messenger and approval of this guest must be explicitly given by us, the hosts. Violation of this rule will result in immediate cancellation of your reservation and termination of your stay. 

Mail:
Please notify the host if you want to have Mail/Parcels shipped to you during your stay.

Quiet Hours:
Quiet Hours at the residence are between the hours of 10pm and 7am Sunday-Thursday and 12am and 7am on Friday-Saturday.

This is a Shared Space with many Travelers all visiting Chicago for a different purpose.  Having common courtesy is more than enough to fulfill this rule.  If you're a Late Night personality, please respect those waking up early for work.  If you're up at the crack of dawn, please get ready as quietly as possible as to not disturb those still asleep.

Smoking:
There is absolutely no smoking inside of the building.  This includes Electronic Cigarettes and all other forms of Tobacco.

Travelers are more than welcome to Smoke outside of the building.  


Weapons:
Absolutely NO WEAPONS of any sort are allowed inside of the building.  This includes Firearms, Knives, and anything else that can be used in a malicious manner.  Host(s) will have Final Say in what constitutes as a weapon.

Violence:
There will be no violence of any sort tolerated inside of the building.  This includes Physical Violence, Verbal (Arguing, Threats, Intimidation, etc.), and any sort of behavior that causes another person in the house to feel upset. 

â€˜Common Senseâ€™ Rule:
As this is a Shared Building, guests are expected to act in a way which is both Respectful and Inviting to everyone else sharing the space.   Actions which are deemed to have a Negative Impact on the overall experience of the other travelers will not be tolerated.  A few examples of this would be:  Leaving Dishes unwashed in the sink, being excessively messy or loud, or just having a negative, unwelcoming attitude.  If Behavior is causing other Travelers to feel uncomfortable, we will ask you to make necessary corrections, if these corrections are not made, we will terminate your stay.

Illegal Activity:
Any action which is in violation of any law within the city of Chicago and the state of Illinois is grounds for instant Termination


Check-Out Rules:
Check out is at 10AM, which is when the cleaning crew arrives. 
All guests that FAIL to vacate the premises prior to the 10AM check out will be charged $50 - No Exceptions!
interaction:

I will, however, be on location in the event that you need anything during your stay, and I am always a Text, Phone Call, or AirBnb Message away to ensure that all of my Guests have an Amazing, 5-Star Experience!

description:
This private room features 3 separate beds perfect for 3 travelers and an early check-in (1 pm)! The apartment is professionally designed and includes FREE PARKING. You will have your own door code and may arrive and as late as you wish, no-hassle check-in guaranteed. 

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. 

The neighborhood is safe even at night!

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)

The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door. 

> EARLY CHECK-IN! 1 pm!

> VERY CLEAN room

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> 3 different beds with sheets, blankets and towels. Memory foam GREEN TEA mattresses.

> Apartment is NEWLY renovated and PROFESSIONALLY designed by an interior designer

> 5 MIN to DOWNTOWN

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance 

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO 

> 3 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago)

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

> Full-sized mirror

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if a last-minute booking. I will also be providing a binder full of local recommendations to eat and go out, you will find the binder on the bed in your room.

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

The closest public transportation BLUE LINE is UIC HALSTED and is a 3 minute walk. It takes you to Willis Tower, Millenium Park and almost every other tourist destination in under 10 minutes!

additional_house_rules:
Quiet Hours:  Between 8:00 P.M. and 8:00 A.M. please respect our neighbors by only using keeping noise at a conversational level when outdoors. We also ask that from the hours of 10 P.M. to 8 A.M. noise in the apartment is at the level where it can be heard by those in the same room but not from one end of the unit to the other.

Using the laundry: There is a washer and dryer available in the basement for guests to use. They are not used for our family but I do use them to wash linens for the apartment. (I want to be sure to keep them separate from our family laundry out of consideration to guest who may have cat allergies.) If you need to use the laundry please give me as much notice as you can so I can remove any of the linens that may be mid cycle.

Using the pull-out couch: If you choose to use the pullout couches for sleeping, you must use the  provided linens and mattress protector. They are located under the cushions of the chaise part of the couch. Once you remove the linens you can conveniently store the couch cushions in the cleared space while you are sleeping. If you require assistance please let your host know.

Special Concerns: Please do not place luggage on any of the furniture or beds. There are dressers available for your clothes and suitcases can also be placed in the coat closet in the living room to be kept out of the way. 

Avoid eating or drinking items that easily stain (wine, flaming hot Cheetos, etc.) in the living area or bedrooms.

description:
This newly remodeled guest suite provides you with 2 bedrooms, a full bath, a cozy living room, and a fully equipped kitchen. The tranquil location and light, airy feel of the space make it a peaceful place to rest during a visit to the busy city. Located near public transit to downtown and a short drive or train ride to the airport, it is the perfect combination of convenient, quiet, and comfortable. Also, there is free street parking in front of the building.

The suite is on the second floor of an older Chicago home. There is no cable or TV but we do have games and books for times when you are staying in. There is high-speed WiFi available if you want to use your computer or tablet for streaming video.

There is laundry available in the basement for our guests. It is dedicated for the Airbnb. In addition to guest use, it is used to wash linens for the apartment when guests check-out. It can be made available for a guest at any time but communication with me will be needed to ensure it is available when desired.

I live on first floor and will be available as needed. Feel free to contact via text, call, or knock on the door if there is anything you need.

Jefferson Park is known as "The Gateway to Chicago." It has long been thought of as a transportation hub connecting the Northwest Suburbs to the City. People who want the convenience of suburban parking lots and availability of chain stores will be able to find what they need in the nearby suburbs. Those who want to spend their time downtown and use public transportation will also have great options. For those who want a little of both, it is ideal. The neighborhood itself is a quiet community of mostly long-term Chicago residents. Local shopping and restaurants are available within easy walking distance. 

There are also nearby forest preserves with trails for running, walking, or bike riding. If you look closely you may find a family of deer! There are also three public parks within a 2 mile radius. Two of the parks have free public pools. Please ask if you would like to see the schedules.

Located in the Jefferson Park neighborhood in North West Chicago, there is easy access to Blue Line and the Metra UP-NW trains. O'Hare Airport is a 15-20 min commute or 30 mins by public transit. There is free parking on the street.

additional_house_rules:
Smoking is not allowed in, on or within 25 feet of the property. This is out of respect to our neighbors.

You are limited to the number of guests listed in your reservation (max 5 without an additional guest charge). There is a maximum of 4 extra guests allowed with an extra fee. Only registered guests may enter the property, without prior consent of the host.

Check- in is with the host between 3:00 - 5:00PM. We can usually accommodate earlier or later check in. Please arrange this with your host after booking. If there are multiple people in your party, please note that the host will only greet the people that arrive during check-in time. After that, your first arrival will have to greet your remaining party members who arrive past the check-in time. We can accommodate previous guests who have stayed before with lock box check-in for arrivals at or after the check-in time.

There is a $200 fee for any lost key or key that is not returned prior to check out.

Each guest is provided with a set of towels for use during their stay. Towels must be left onsite upon departure. There is a replacement fee for any towels not returned prior to check out. 

Any damaged or missing items will incur a replacement fee after check out.

By booking, the guests agree to the house rules and agree to read the house manual and follow all rules therein. The guests understand that if any rules are not adhered to that they may be asked to leave immediately and will not receive a refund for any part of their booking.

Guests renting additional rooms or space in the house or gardens will be provided with documentation in the form of an agreement regarding details, pricing and additional rules for use of that space. The above rules apply for rentals of any kind.

Please text us with any needs, questions or emergencies that occur before or after arrival.

Thank you.

access:
The Guest Suite occupies the entire third floor, which includes 3 bedrooms, a bathroom, full kitchen and ballroom. There is an additional bedroom on the second floor that can be included with an extra rental fee. 

(Upon availability, bedrooms can be booked singularly, for one or two guests. In that case, the bathroom and kitchen might be shared with other guests.  If the second floor bedroom is rented singularly, there is no kitchen access.)

There is a separate entrance and guests take the back staircase to the third floor. The third floor area is totally private and the host does not use nor access this space while you are a guest.

Bicycles (two adult, one child and a Tandem) and (2) beach passes are available for your enjoyment.

Guests can use other parts of the house or garden for small events or private get togethers. For instance, enjoy high tea, cocktails or wine and cheese on the outside terrace or have a private dinner catered in the grand dining room. Gardens can be used for anything from a formal wedding to a casual barbecue. Please inquire for rates and options available.

*There is no access to the first and second floor, unless they have been rented separately for an event or added experience.
description:
Stay in the Guest Suite of this exquisitely restored Historic Landmark Manor House, one block to Lake Michigan's beaches and close to town and NU. Enjoy the entire third floor, which includes three bedrooms, a private bath with claw-foot soaking tub and shower, private kitchen with full amenities, and a ballroom, in case you feel like dancing! The ballroom can be equipped with a couch and air mattress for any extra guests. Also available is an additional second floor bedroom for a sixth guest.

The Guest Suite is situated in a beautiful historic Manor House built in 1914 and designed by famed architect Earnest Mayo. The entire house was restored to its original splendor and has since won several awards and been seen on TV and in movies. The house is both a National and Evanston landmark and is situated in the Lakeshore Historic District. The guest suite occupies the entire restored third floor (apx 2500 sq ft), which includes three bedrooms, a bathroom, full kitchen and a ballroom. 

There is also a single bedroom on the second floor that can be used for an extra guest. Please inquire regarding fees.

The house and gardens can also be rented for private parties and small gatherings. Please inquire for details and pricing. Additional documentation in the form of an agreement regarding pricing and rules for use of the space will require signature, if interested.

The Guest Suite occupies the entire third floor, which includes 3 bedrooms, a bathroom, full kitchen and ballroom. There is an additional bedroom on the second floor that can be included with an extra rental fee. 

(Upon availability, bedrooms can be booked singularly, for one or two guests. In that case, the bathroom and kitchen might be shared with other guests.  If the second floor bedroom is rented singularly, there is no kitchen access.)

There is a separate entrance and guests take the back staircase to the third floor. The third floor area is totally private and the host does not use nor access this space while you are a guest.

Bicycles (two adult, one child and a Tandem) and (2) beach passes are available for your enjoyment.

Guests can use other parts of the house or garden for small events or private get togethers. For instance, enjoy high tea, cocktails or wine and cheese on the outside terrace or have a private dinner catered in the grand dining room. Gardens can be used for anything from a formal wedding to a casual barbecue. Please inquire for rates and options available.

*There is no access to the first and second floor, unless they have been rented separately for an event or added experience.

The host respects the privacy of their guests and therefore, is fairly hands-off. However, any special requests can be made in advance or upon arrival and we are always only a text away with any questions or desires you may have 24/7.

We are located in the heart of Evanston's Lakeshore Historic district, only one block to the best beaches, with all that the lakefront has to offer; including boat and paddle board rentals, tennis, fitness trail, running/cycling paths and concessions. We are a short walk to NU and town, which includes grocery, coffee shops, restaurants, movie theatre, antique and boutique shops and other attractions.

We are in a very walkable neighborhood and bicycles are available, as well. Evanston also has public Divvy bikes to rent. If venturing to downtown Chicago for a meeting or sightseeing, you can use either the el train/CTA (like a subway but elevated) or Metra train. The stop for either is a short walk. There is also a CTA bus to the mall. Car rentals, taxi's and Uber are also readily available. If coming from the airport, the easiest method is Uber and more cost effective than a taxi. However, the most inexpensive is the el train.

License #
house_rules:
Smoking is not allowed in, on or within 25 feet of the property. This is out of respect to our neighbors.

You are limited to the number of guests listed in your reservation (max 5 without an additional guest charge). There is a maximum of 4 extra guests allowed with an extra fee. Only registered guests may enter the property, without prior consent of the host.

Check- in is with the host between 3:00 - 5:00PM. We can usually accommodate earlier or later check in. Please arrange this with your host after booking. If there are multiple people in your party, please note that the host will only greet the people that arrive during check-in time. After that, your first arrival will have to greet your remaining party members who arrive past the check-in time. We can accommodate previous guests who have stayed before with lock box check-in for arrivals at or after the check-in time.

There is a $200 fee for any lost key or key that is not returned prior to check out.

Each guest is provided with a set of towels for use during their stay. Towels must be left onsite upon departure. There is a replacement fee for any towels not returned prior to check out. 

Any damaged or missing items will incur a replacement fee after check out.

By booking, the guests agree to the house rules and agree to read the house manual and follow all rules therein. The guests understand that if any rules are not adhered to that they may be asked to leave immediately and will not receive a refund for any part of their booking.

Guests renting additional rooms or space in the house or gardens will be provided with documentation in the form of an agreement regarding details, pricing and additional rules for use of that space. The above rules apply for rentals of any kind.

Please text us with any needs, questions or emergencies that occur before or after arrival.

Thank you.
